Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles downloading and processing images with size limitations and compression capabilities.

Class Description: The Picture class is designed to download images from given URLs while enforcing size limits and compression thresholds. It uses cURL for HTTP requests and provides mechanisms to control download size and handle response data efficiently.

Attributes:

- sizeLimit: [int] - The maximum dimension (in pixels) for the image width/height

Methods:

  - $url: The URL of the image to download

Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified URL or file path, with support for HTTP requests using fsockopen, including handling of proxy servers, authentication, and security checks.

Function Description: The function retrieves content from either a local file or a remote HTTP resource. For HTTP requests, it establishes a socket connection, sends a GET request with appropriate headers (including authentication if provided), reads the response, and extracts the content body. It includes security checks for trusted URIs and resource directories when operating within a Smarty template context.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string) Required. The URL or file path to fetch
  - 'assign': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign the content to
  - 'assign_headers': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign headers to
  - 'user': (string) Optional. Username for HTTP authentication
  - 'pass': (string) Optional. Password for HTTP authentication
  - 'proxy_host': (string) Optional. Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (integer) Optional. Proxy server port
- $template: The Smarty template object (used for security checks and variable assignment)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if no 'assign' parameter is provided
- Assigns the content to the specified template variable if 'assign' parameter is present
- Returns nothing if security checks fail or if there are errors in fetching the content

Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified HTTP URL using fsockopen for low-level HTTP communication, with support for proxy configuration and timeout settings.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy server if configured), sends an HTTP GET request, reads the response, and returns the response body. It handles URL parsing, connection establishment, request sending, response reading, and connection closing. The function can either return the fetched content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string, required) The HTTP URL to fetch
  - 'proxy_host': (string, optional) Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (integer, optional) Proxy server port
  - 'timeout': (integer, optional) Connection timeout in seconds (default: 30)
  - 'assign': (string, optional) Template variable name to assign the content to
- $template: (object) The template object for assigning content when 'assign' parameter is used

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if 'assign' parameter is not provided
- Returns nothing (void) if 'assign' parameter is provided (content is assigned to template instead)
right_result:
<?php
function fetch_http_content($params, $template) {
    $file = $params['file'];
    $proxy_host = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['proxy_host'] : null;
    $proxy_port = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : null;
    $timeout = isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 30;
    $assign = isset($params['assign']) ? $params['assign'] : null;

    // Parse URL
    $parsed_url = parse_url($file);
    if (!isset($parsed_url['scheme']) || !isset($parsed_url['host'])) {
        return false;
    }

    $scheme = $parsed_url['scheme'];
    $host = $parsed_url['host'];
    $port = isset($parsed_url['port']) ? $parsed_url['port'] : ($scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
    $path = isset($parsed_url['path']) ? $parsed_url['path'] : '/';
    $query = isset($parsed_url['query']) ? '?' . $parsed_url['query'] : '';

    // Determine the target host and port
    $target_host = $host;
    $target_port = $port;

    // If proxy is configured, use it
    if ($proxy_host && $proxy_port) {
        $target_host = $proxy_host;
        $target_port = $proxy_port;
    }

    // Open connection
    $fp = fsockopen($target_host, $target_port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    if (!$fp) {
        return false;
    }

    // Prepare HTTP request
    $request = "GET $path$query HTTP/1.1\r\n";
    $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";

    // Send request
    fwrite($fp, $request);

    // Read response
    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 1024);
    }

    // Close connection
    fclose($fp);

    // Extract body from response
    $body_start = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    if ($body_start === false) {
        return false;
    }
    $body = substr($response, $body_start + 4);

    // Assign to template or return
    if ($assign) {
        $template->$assign = $body;
    } else {
        return $body;
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using either cURL (if available) or fsockopen as a fallback, supporting both GET and POST methods with various configurations.

Function Description: The function _dfsockopen performs HTTP requests to a specified URL with support for POST data, cookies, custom headers, file uploads, and timeout settings. It first attempts to use cURL if available, falling back to fsockopen for basic socket communication. The function handles both URL-encoded and multipart form data for POST requests.

Input:
- $url: (string) The target URL for the HTTP request
- $limit: (int) Maximum number of bytes to read from response (0 for unlimited)
- $post: (string|array) POST data to send (either query string or associative array)
- $cookie: (string) Cookie header string
- $bysocket: (bool) Force using fsockopen (unused in this implementation)
- $ip: (string) Specific IP to connect to (bypassing DNS)
- $timeout: (int) Connection timeout in seconds
- $block: (bool) Whether to use blocking I/O
- $encodetype: (string) POST data encoding type ('URLENCODE' or other for multipart)
- $allowcurl: (bool) Whether to allow cURL usage
- $position: (int) Unused parameter
- $files: (array) Associative array of file paths for file uploads

Output:
- Returns: (string) The HTTP response body (limited by $limit if specified)
- Side effect: Sets $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] with response headers
- Returns empty string on connection failure or non-200 status code (for cURL)
right_result:
<?php
function _dfsockopen($url, $limit, $post, $cookie, $bysocket, $ip, $timeout, $block, $encodetype, $allowcurl, $position, $files) {
    if ($allowcurl && function_exists('curl_init')) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $timeout);
        if ($cookie) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIE, $cookie);
        }
        if ($post) {
            if ($encodetype === 'URLENCODE') {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($post));
            } else {
                $post_fields = [];
                foreach ($post as $key => $value) {
                    $post_fields[] = "$key=" . urlencode($value);
                }
                $post_string = implode('&', $post_fields);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $post_string);
            }
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $http_code = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);
        if ($http_code != 200) {
            return '';
        }
        if ($limit > 0) {
            $response = substr($response, 0, $limit);
        }
        $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] = substr($response, 0, strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n"));
        return $response;
    } else {
        $fp = fsockopen($ip ? $ip : 'localhost', 80, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
        if (!$fp) {
            return '';
        }
        $request = "GET $url HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: " . parse_url($url, PHP_URL_HOST) . "\r\n";
        $request .= "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0\r\n";
        $request .= "Accept: */*\r\n";
        if ($cookie) {
            $request .= "Cookie: $cookie\r\n";
        }
        $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
        if ($post) {
            if ($encodetype === 'URLENCODE') {
                $request = "POST $url HTTP/1.1\r\n";
                $request .= "Host: " . parse_url($url, PHP_URL_HOST) . "\r\n";
                $request .= "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0\r\n";
                $request .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
                $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen(http_build_query($post)) . "\r\n";
                $request .= "Cookie: $cookie\r\n";
                $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
                $request .= http_build_query($post);
            } else {
                $boundary = md5(uniqid());
                $request = "POST $url HTTP/1.1\r\n";
                $request .= "Host: " . parse_url($url, PHP_URL_HOST) . "\r\n";
                $request .= "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0\r\n";
                $request .= "Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=$boundary\r\n";
                $request .= "Cookie: $cookie\r\n";
                $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
                $request .= "--$boundary\r\n";
                $request .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$_POST\"\r\n\r\n";
                $request .= http_build_query($post) . "\r\n";
                $request .= "--$boundary\r\n";
                $request .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"files\"; filename=\"" . $files['name'] . "\"\r\n";
                $request .= "Content-Type: application/octet-stream\r\n\r\n";
                $request .= file_get_contents($files['tmp_name']) . "\r\n";
                $request .= "--$boundary--\r\n";
            }
        }
        fwrite($fp, $request);
        $response = "";
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $response .= fgets($fp, 1024);
        }
        fclose($fp);
        if ($limit > 0) {
            $response = substr($response, 0, $limit);
        }
        $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] = substr($response, 0, strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n"));
        return $response;
    }
}
?>

Task Description: Create a RabbitMQ consumer class in PHP that connects to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, and processes incoming messages until a termination signal is received.

Class Description: The RabbitMQConsumer class handles the consumption of messages from a RabbitMQ queue. It establishes a connection to the server, sets up the necessary queue and exchange, processes messages, and provides shutdown functionality.

Attributes:
- msgCount: [int] - Tracks the number of messages processed
- startTime: [float|null] - Records the start time of message processing
- conn: [AMQPStreamConnection] - Holds the RabbitMQ server connection
- ch: [AMQPChannel] - Represents the communication channel
- exchange: [string] - Name of the exchange to bind to
- queue: [string] - Name of the queue to consume from
- consumer_tag: [string] - Identifier for the consumer (empty in this implementation)

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the RabbitMQ connection, channel, exchange, and queue
- process_message([AMQPMessage] $msg) -> [void] - Processes incoming messages and handles termination signal
- startConsuming() -> [void] - Starts consuming messages from the queue
- shutdown() -> [void] - Closes the channel and connection cleanly
right_result:
<?php
require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Channel\AMQPChannel;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

class RabbitMQConsumer {
    public $msgCount;
    public $startTime;
    public $conn;
    public $ch;
    public $exchange;
    public $queue;
    public $consumer_tag;

    public function __construct($exchange, $queue) {
        $this->exchange = $exchange;
        $this->queue = $queue;
        $this->msgCount = 0;
        $this->startTime = null;
        $this->conn = new AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'guest', 'guest');
        $this->ch = $this->conn->channel();
    }

    public function process_message($msg) {
        $this->msgCount++;
        $this->startTime = $this->startTime === null ? microtime(true) : $this->startTime;

        $body = $msg->body;
        if ($body === 'terminate') {
            echo "Termination signal received. Shutting down...\n";
            $this->shutdown();
            exit;
        }

        echo "Received message: $body\n";
    }

    public function startConsuming() {
        $this->ch->queue_declare($this->queue, false, true, false, false, false, false, $this->consumer_tag);
        $this->ch->exchange_declare($this->exchange, 'direct', false, false, false, false, false, false, false);
        $this->ch->queue_bind($this->queue, $this->exchange);

        $this->startTime = microtime(true);

        $this->ch->basic_consume($this->queue, '', false, true, false, false, function ($msg) {
            $this->process_message($msg);
        });

        while ($this->ch->is_consuming()) {
            $this->ch->wait();
        }
    }

    public function shutdown() {
        $this->ch->close();
        $this->conn->close();
    }
}

$consumer = new RabbitMQConsumer('my_exchange', 'my_queue');
$consumer->startConsuming();

Task Description: Create a Redis cache driver class for CodeIgniter that implements basic cache operations using Redis as the backend storage.

Class Description: The CI_Cache_redis class extends CI_Driver and provides an interface for caching data in Redis. It handles connection management, serialization of complex data types, and standard cache operations like get, save, delete, increment, and decrement.

Attributes:
- $_default_config: [array] - Default configuration for Redis connection
- $_redis: [Redis] - Redis client instance
- $_serialized: [array] - Track which keys contain serialized data

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes Redis connection using configuration
- get($key) -> [mixed] - Retrieves data from cache by key
- save($id, $data, $ttl = 60, $raw = FALSE) -> [bool] - Stores data in cache with optional TTL
- delete($key) -> [bool] - Removes data from cache by key
- increment($id, $offset = 1) -> [int|bool] - Increments a numeric value in cache
- decrement($id, $offset = 1) -> [int|bool] - Decrements a numeric value in cache
- clean() -> [bool] - Clears all cache entries
- cache_info($type = NULL) -> [array] - Returns Redis server information
- get_metadata($key) -> [array|bool] - Returns metadata about a cache entry
- is_supported() -> [bool] - Checks if Redis extension is loaded
- __destruct() -> [void] - Closes Redis connection when object is destroyed
right_result:
<?php
defined('BASEPATH') OR exit('No direct script access allowed');

class CI_Cache_redis extends CI_Driver {

    protected $_default_config = array(
        'hostname' => '127.0.0.1',
        'port' => 6379,
        'password' => '',
        'timeout' => 2.5,
        'pconnect' => FALSE,
        'database' => 0
    );

    protected $_redis;
    protected $_serialized = array();

    public function __construct($config = array()) {
        parent::__construct($config);

        $this->_redis = new Redis();
        $this->_redis->connect($this->_default_config['hostname'], $this->_default_config['port'], $this->_default_config['timeout']);
        if ($this->_default_config['password']) {
            $this->_redis->auth($this->_default_config['password']);
        }
        if ($this->_default_config['pconnect']) {
            $this->_redis->pconnect($this->_default_config['hostname'], $this->_default_config['port'], $this->_default_config['timeout']);
        }
        $this->_redis->select($this->_default_config['database']);
    }

    public function get($key) {
        $data = $this->_redis->get($key);
        if ($data === false) {
            return false;
        }
        if (isset($this->_serialized[$key])) {
            return unserialize($data);
        }
        return $data;
    }

    public function save($id, $data, $ttl = 60, $raw = FALSE) {
        if ($raw) {
            $this->_serialized[$id] = true;
        } else {
            $this->_serialized[$id] = false;
        }
        return $this->_redis->setex($id, $ttl, $data);
    }

    public function delete($key) {
        return $this->_redis->delete($key);
    }

    public function increment($id, $offset = 1) {
        return $this->_redis->incrby($id, $offset);
    }

    public function decrement($id, $offset = 1) {
        return $this->_redis->decrby($id, $offset);
    }

    public function clean() {
        return $this->_redis->flushDB();
    }

    public function cache_info($type = NULL) {
        $info = $this->_redis->info();
        return $info;
    }

    public function get_metadata($key) {
        $meta = $this->_redis->debug('meta', $key);
        if ($meta === false) {
            return false;
        }
        return $meta;
    }

    public function is_supported() {
        return extension_loaded('redis');
    }

    public function __destruct() {
        if ($this->_redis) {
            $this->_redis->close();
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Redis wrapper class in PHP that provides a simplified interface for connecting to and interacting with a Redis server, including connection management, basic operations, and error handling.

Class Description: The cls_redis class is a singleton-style wrapper for PHP's Redis extension that manages Redis connections, provides common Redis operations, and handles connection errors gracefully. It supports multiple connection configurations, automatic reconnection on failure, and key prefixing.

Attributes:

Attribute1: protected static $redis - Redis - Singleton Redis instance (deprecated)
Attribute2: protected static $configs - array - Stores Redis connection configurations
Attribute3: private static $links - array - Maintains active Redis connections
Attribute4: private static $link_name - string - Current connection name (default 'default')
Attribute5: public static $prefix - string - Default key prefix ('phpspider')
Attribute6: public static $error - string - Stores last error message

Methods:

Method1: init() -> Redis|false - Initializes and returns a Redis connection instance
Method2: set(string $key, mixed $value, int $expire = 0) -> bool|null - Stores a value in Redis with optional expiration
Method3: get(string $key) -> mixed|null - Retrieves a value from Redis by key
Method4: clear_link() -> void - Closes all active Redis connections
Method5: _get_default_config() -> array - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings
right_result:
<?php
class cls_redis {
    protected static $redis;
    protected static $configs = [];
    private static $links = [];
    private static $link_name = 'default';
    public static $prefix = 'phpspider';
    public static $error = '';

    public static function init() {
        if (self::$redis) {
            return self::$redis;
        }

        $config = self::_get_default_config();
        if (!$config) {
            self::$error = 'No default Redis configuration found.';
            return false;
        }

        self::$link_name = isset($_SERVER['REDISC_LINK']) ? $_SERVER['REDISC_LINK'] : 'default';
        self::$links[self::$link_name] = new Redis();

        if (!self::$links[self::$link_name]->connect($config['host'], $config['port'])) {
            self::$error = "Failed to connect to Redis server at {$config['host']}:{$config['port']}";
            return false;
        }

        if (isset($config['password'])) {
            self::$links[self::$link_name]->auth($config['password']);
        }

        self::$redis = self::$links[self::$link_name];
        return self::$redis;
    }

    public static function set(string $key, mixed $value, int $expire = 0): bool|null {
        $key = self::$prefix . ':' . $key;
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) {
            return null;
        }

        try {
            if ($expire > 0) {
                $redis->setex($key, $expire, $value);
            } else {
                $redis->set($key, $value);
            }
            return true;
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            self::$error = 'Error setting key in Redis: ' . $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public static function get(string $key): mixed|null {
        $key = self::$prefix . ':' . $key;
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) {
            return null;
        }

        try {
            $value = $redis->get($key);
            return $value === false ? null : $value;
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            self::$error = 'Error getting key from Redis: ' . $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public static function clear_link() {
        foreach (self::$links as $name => $redis) {
            $redis->close();
        }
        self::$links = [];
        self::$redis = null;
    }

    private static function _get_default_config(): array {
        $config = [
            'host' => '127.0.0.1',
            'port' => 6379,
            'password' => '',
        ];

        if (file_exists(__DIR__ . '/config/redis.php')) {
            $config = include __DIR__ . '/config/redis.php';
        }

        return $config;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Symfony's HTTP client components to handle HTTP requests and responses.

Class Description: The HttpClientKernel class is an implementation of HttpKernelInterface that provides HTTP client capabilities using Symfony's HTTP client components. It handles HTTP requests by sending them to a remote server and returning the response, supporting various request methods, headers, cookies, and body content (including form data and file uploads).

Attributes:
- client: [HttpClientInterface] - The Symfony HTTP client instance used to send requests

Methods:
- __construct(?HttpClientInterface $client = null) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client. If no client is provided, creates a default HttpClient instance. Throws an exception if the HttpClient component is not installed.
- handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true) -> [Response] - Processes an HTTP request by sending it to the target server and returns the response. Handles headers, cookies, and request body preparation.
- getBody(Request $request) -> [?AbstractPart] - Prepares the request body content. Returns null for GET/HEAD requests, a TextPart for raw content, or a FormDataPart for form data including file uploads. Throws an exception if the Mime component is not installed when needed.
- getHeaders(Request $request) -> [array] - Extracts and formats headers from the request object, including cookies, into an array suitable for the HTTP client.

<?php

use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\HttpClient;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Exception\ClientException;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Exception\DecodingException;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Exception\ServerException;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Exception\TransportException;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Request;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Response;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\MimeTypes;
use Symfony\Component\Serializer\Normalizer\AbstractNormalizer;
use Symfony\Component\Serializer\SerializerInterface;
use Symfony\Contracts\HttpClient\HttpClientInterface;
use Symfony\Contracts\HttpClient\ResponseInterface;

class HttpClientKernel implements \Symfony\Component\HttpKernel\HttpKernelInterface
{
    private $client;

    public function __construct(?HttpClientInterface $client = null)
    {
        if (null === $client) {
            try {
                $this->client = HttpClient::create();
            } catch (\Exception $e) {
                throw new \RuntimeException('The Symfony HTTP client component is not installed.', 0, $e);
            }
        } else {
            $this->client = $client;
        }
    }

    public function handle(Request $request, int $type = self::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true): Response
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $method = $request->getMethod();

        $headers = $this->getHeaders($request);
        $body = $this->getBody($request);

        try {
            $response = $this->client->request($method, $uri, [
                'headers' => $headers,
                'body' => $body,
            ]);
        } catch (TransportException $e) {
            if ($catch) {
                return new Response($e->getMessage(), 503);
            }
            throw $e;
        } catch (ClientException $e) {
            if ($catch) {
                return new Response($e->getMessage(), $e->getCode());
            }
            throw $e;
        } catch (ServerException $e) {
            if ($catch) {
                return new Response($e->getMessage(), $e->getCode());
            }
            throw $e;
        } catch (DecodingException $e) {
            if ($catch) {
                return new Response($e->getMessage(), 500);
            }
            throw $e;
        }

        return new Response($response->getBody()->getContents(), $response->getStatusCode(), $response->getHeaders());
    }

    public function getBody(Request $request): ?AbstractPart
    {
        $method = $request->getMethod();

        if (in_array($method, ['GET', 'HEAD'])) {
            return null;
        }

        $content = $request->getContent();
        $contentType = $request->headers->get('Content-Type');

        if (MimeTypes::isMimeType($contentType, 'multipart/form-data')) {
            return new \Symfony\Component\HttpClient\FormDataPart($content);
        }

        return new \Symfony\Component\HttpClient\TextPart($content);
    }

    public function getHeaders(Request $request): array
    {
        $headers = [];

        foreach ($request->headers->all() as $name => $values) {
            $headers[$name] = $values;
        }

        $cookies = $request->cookies->all();
        foreach ($cookies as $name => $value) {
            $headers['Cookie'][] = "$name=$value";
        }

        return $headers;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a WebSocket server in PHP using stream_socket_server that handles client connections, processes requests, and sends responses.

Class Description: The Server class implements a WebSocket server that listens for incoming connections, handles client requests through callbacks, and manages socket communication. It supports non-blocking operations and provides hooks for custom logic.

Attributes:
- host: string - The host address to bind the server to
- port: int - The port number to listen on
- output: OutputInterface - Interface for debug and status output
- stop: bool - Flag to control server shutdown
- socket: resource - The main server socket resource
- clientSockets: array - Array of connected client sockets
- afterCallback: Closure - Callback executed after server starts
- tickerCallback: Closure - Periodic callback during server loop
- routerCallback: Closure - Request routing callback

Methods:
- __construct(string $host, int $port, OutputInterface $output) -> void - Initializes server with host, port and output interface
- checkRequiredExtensionsExists() -> void - Validates required PHP extensions are loaded
- run() -> void - Starts the server main loop
- createServerSocket() -> resource - Creates and configures the server socket
- updatePort() -> void - Updates the port number from actual socket binding
- acceptNewConnections() -> void - Accepts new client connections
- handleClientRequests() -> void - Processes requests from connected clients
- readClientRequest(resource $clientSocket) -> string - Reads complete request from client
- parseRequest(string $request) -> array - Parses request into path and payload
- sendResponse(resource $clientSocket, Response $response) -> void - Sends formatted response to client
- closeClientSocket(resource $clientSocket, int $key) -> void - Closes and removes client socket
- afterRun(Closure $param) -> void - Sets after-start callback
- ticker(Closure $param) -> void - Sets periodic tick callback
- router(Closure $param) -> void - Sets request routing callback
- stop() -> void - Signals server to stop
right_result:
<?php
class Server {
    public $host;
    public $port;
    public $output;
    public $stop;
    public $socket;
    public $clientSockets;
    public $afterCallback;
    public $tickerCallback;
    public $routerCallback;

    public function __construct(string $host, int $port, OutputInterface $output) {
        $this->host = $host;
        $this->port = $port;
        $this->output = $output;
        $this->stop = false;
        $this->clientSockets = [];
    }

    public function checkRequiredExtensionsExists() {
        if (!extension_loaded('sockets')) {
            throw new Exception("Extension 'sockets' is not loaded.");
        }
        if (!extension_loaded('json')) {
            throw new Exception("Extension 'json' is not loaded.");
        }
    }

    public function run() {
        $this->checkRequiredExtensionsExists();
        $this->socket = $this->createServerSocket();
        $this->output->writeln("WebSocket server started on {$this->host}:{$this->port}");

        if ($this->afterCallback) {
            $this->afterCallback();
        }

        while (!$this->stop) {
            $this->acceptNewConnections();
            $this->handleClientRequests();
            if ($this->tickerCallback) {
                $this->tickerCallback();
            }
        }

        $this->output->writeln("WebSocket server stopped.");
    }

    public function createServerSocket() {
        $context = stream_context_create([
            'ssl' => [
                'allow_self_signed' => true,
                'reject_unknown_ca' => false,
                'verify_peer' => false,
                'verify_depth' => 0,
            ]
        ]);

        return stream_socket_server("tcp://{$this->host}:{$this->port}", $errno, $errstr, STREAM_SERVER_BLOCK, $context);
    }

    public function updatePort() {
        $this->port = stream_socket_get_name($this->socket, PHP_STREAM_AF_INET);
    }

    public function acceptNewConnections() {
        while ($this->stop === false && $newSocket = @stream_socket_accept($this->socket, 30)) {
            $this->clientSockets[] = $newSocket;
            $this->output->writeln("New client connected.");
        }
    }

    public function handleClientRequests() {
        $read = $this->clientSockets;
        $write = [];
        $except = [];

        if (stream_select($read, $write, $except, 0, 100000)) {
            foreach ($read as $key => $clientSocket) {
                if (in_array($clientSocket, $write)) {
                    continue;
                }

                $request = $this->readClientRequest($clientSocket);
                if ($request) {
                    list($path, $payload) = $this->parseRequest($request);
                    if ($this->routerCallback) {
                        $this->routerCallback($path, $payload, $clientSocket);
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }

    public function readClientRequest(resource $clientSocket) {
        $buffer = '';
        while (true) {
            $data = fread($clientSocket, 8192);
            if ($data === false) {
                return false;
            }
            $buffer .= $data;
            if (substr_count($buffer, "\r\n\r\n") > 0) {
                break;
            }
        }
        return $buffer;
    }

    public function parseRequest(string $request) {
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $request);
        $firstLine = $lines[0];
        $path = strtok($firstLine, ' ');
        $payload = '';

        for ($i = 1; $i < count($lines); $i++) {
            if (substr($lines[$i], 0, 4) === 'HTTP') {
                break;
            }
            $payload .= $lines[$i] . "\r\n";
        }

        return [$path, $payload];
    }

    public function sendResponse(resource $clientSocket, Response $response) {
        $responseString = $response->toString();
        fwrite($clientSocket, $responseString);
    }

    public function closeClientSocket(resource $clientSocket, int $key) {
        unset($this->clientSockets[$key]);
        fclose($clientSocket);
        $this->output->writeln("Client disconnected.");
    }

    public function afterRun(Closure $param) {
        $this->afterCallback = $param;
    }

    public function ticker(Closure $param) {
        $this->tickerCallback = $param;
    }

    public function router(Closure $param) {
        $this->routerCallback = $param;
    }

    public function stop() {
        $this->stop = true;
        foreach ($this->clientSockets as $socket) {
            fclose($socket);
        }
        fclose($this->socket);
    }
}

interface OutputInterface {
    public function writeln(string $message);
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Symfony's HTTP client components to handle HTTP requests and responses.

Class Description: The `HttpClientKernel` class is a Symfony HTTP client implementation that handles HTTP requests by sending them to a server and processing the responses. It supports various request methods, headers, cookies, and body content (including form data and file uploads).

Attributes:
- client: [HttpClientInterface] - The Symfony HTTP client instance used to send requests

Methods:
- __construct([HttpClientInterface $client = null]) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client. If no client is provided, creates a new instance. Requires Symfony HTTP client component.
- handle([Request $request], [int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST], [bool $catch = true]) -> [Response] - Processes an HTTP request, sends it using the client, and returns the response. Handles headers, cookies, and request body.
- getBody([Request $request]) -> [AbstractPart|null] - Prepares the request body content. Returns null for GET/HEAD requests, TextPart for raw content, or FormDataPart for form data including files.
- getHeaders([Request $request]) -> [array] - Prepares request headers including cookies from the request object. Returns an array of headers.

<?php

use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\HttpClient;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Hydrator\NormalizerInterface;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Response\ResponseInterface;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Request;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Response;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Exception\ClientException;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Exception\RedirectionException;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Exception\ServerException;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Exception\TransportException;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\Encoding\StreamedBody;

class HttpClientKernel
{
    protected $client;

    public function __construct(HttpClientInterface $client = null)
    {
        $this->client = $client ?? HttpClient::create();
    }

    public function handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true): Response
    {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->request(
                $request->getMethod(),
                $request->getUri(),
                [
                    'headers' => $this->getHeaders($request),
                    'body' => $this->getBody($request),
                ]
            );

            return new Response($response->getStatusCode(), $response->getHeaders(), $response->getContent());
        } catch (ClientException | RedirectionException | ServerException | TransportException $e) {
            if ($catch) {
                return new Response($e->getResponse()->getStatusCode(), $e->getResponse()->getHeaders(), $e->getResponse()->getContent());
            }
            throw $e;
        }
    }

    public function getBody(Request $request): AbstractPart|null
    {
        if (in_array($request->getMethod(), ['GET', 'HEAD'])) {
            return null;
        }

        if ($request->hasPreviousSession()) {
            $session = $request->getSession();
            $postData = $session->get('post_data');
            if ($postData) {
                return new TextPart($postData);
            }
        }

        $content = $request->getContent();
        if ($content) {
            return new TextPart($content);
        }

        return null;
    }

    public function getHeaders(Request $request): array
    {
        $headers = [];

        foreach ($request->headers->all() as $name => $values) {
            $headers[$name] = $values;
        }

        if ($request->cookies->all()) {
            $headers['Cookie'] = $request->cookies->all();
        }

        return $headers;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a function that executes a shell command and captures its standard output and error streams using PHP's proc_open.

Function Description: The function should execute a given shell command, capture both stdout and stderr streams, properly close all resources, and return the exit code of the process. It should handle cases where process creation fails.

Input:
- $command: string - The shell command to execute
- &$stdout: ?string (optional reference) - Variable to store the standard output
- &$stderr: ?string (optional reference) - Variable to store the standard error

Output:
- int - The exit code of the executed process. Returns -1 if process creation fails.
right_result:
<?php
function executeCommand($command, &$stdout = null, &$stderr = null) {
    $descriptorspec = [
        0 => ['pipe', 'r'],  // stdin is a pipe that the child will read from
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],  // stdout is a pipe that the child will write to
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']   // stderr is a pipe that the child will write to
    ];

    $process = proc_open($command, $descriptorspec, $pipes);

    if (!$process) {
        return -1;
    }

    // Read the output from the command
    $stdout = '';
    if (is_resource($pipes[1])) {
        $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    }

    // Read any error output from the command
    $stderr = '';
    if (is_resource($pipes[2])) {
        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
    }

    // Close all pipes
    fclose($pipes[0]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);

    // Wait for the process to complete
    $exitCode = proc_close($process);

    return $exitCode;
}

Task Description: Create a function that executes system commands using various PHP execution methods, with fallback options from most to least preferred, and returns the command output along with execution method information.

Function Description: The function attempts to execute a system command using multiple PHP execution methods in a prioritized order (COM, exec, shell_exec, system, passthru, popen, proc_open). It handles both Windows and Unix-like systems, sets the working directory, and properly manages process pipes and resources. The function returns the command output and indicates which execution method was successful.

Input:
- $cmd: [string] - The system command to be executed
- $cwd: [string] - The working directory where the command should be executed
- $com: [bool] (optional) - Flag to force using COM method on Windows (default: false)

Output:
- Returns [array] with two elements:
  - 'res': [string] - The output from the executed command
  - 'msg': [string] - Status message indicating the execution method used or NULL if no output
right_result:
<?php
function executeCommand($cmd, $cwd, $com = false) {
    $methods = [];
    if (defined('PHP_WINDOWS_VERSION_BUILD')) {
        $methods[] = ['type' => 'COM', 'func' => function($cmd, $cwd) {
            $obj = new COM("WScript.Shell");
            $obj->SendKeys($cmd . chr(13));
            return '';
        }];
    }
    $methods[] = ['type' => 'exec', 'func' => 'exec'];
    $methods[] = ['type' => 'shell_exec', 'func' => 'shell_exec'];
    $methods[] = ['type' => 'system', 'func' => 'system'];
    $methods[] = ['type' => 'passthru', 'func' => 'passthru'];
    $methods[] = ['type' => 'popen', 'func' => 'popen'];
    $methods[] = ['type' => 'proc_open', 'func' => 'proc_open'];

    $result = ['res' => '', 'msg' => null];
    foreach ($methods as $method) {
        if ($com && !defined('PHP_WINDOWS_VERSION_BUILD')) continue;
        if ($method['type'] === 'COM' && defined('PHP_WINDOWS_VERSION_BUILD')) {
            $output = $method['func']($cmd, $cwd);
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = "Command executed using COM method";
            return $result;
        }
        if ($method['type'] === 'exec') {
            $output = '';
            $args = [$cmd];
            if ($cwd) $args[] = $cwd;
            $output = exec($cmd, $output, $return_var);
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = "Command executed using exec method";
            return $result;
        }
        if ($method['type'] === 'shell_exec') {
            $output = shell_exec($cmd);
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = "Command executed using shell_exec method";
            return $result;
        }
        if ($method['type'] === 'system') {
            $output = system($cmd, $return_var);
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = "Command executed using system method";
            return $result;
        }
        if ($method['type'] === 'passthru') {
            $output = passthru($cmd, $return_var);
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = "Command executed using passthru method";
            return $result;
        }
        if ($method['type'] === 'popen') {
            $handle = popen($cmd, 'r');
            if ($handle) {
                $output = fread($handle, 4096);
                pclose($handle);
                $result['res'] = $output;
                $result['msg'] = "Command executed using popen method";
                return $result;
            }
        }
        if ($method['type'] === 'proc_open') {
            $descriptorspec = [
                0 => ['pipe', 'r'], // stdin
                1 => ['pipe', 'w'], // stdout
                2 => ['pipe', 'w']  // stderr
            ];
            $process = proc_open($cmd, $descriptorspec, $pipes);
            if (is_resource($process)) {
                $output = '';
                if (is_resource($pipes[1])) {
                    $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
                }
                fclose($pipes[1]);
                fclose($pipes[2]);
                $return_var = 0;
                $exit_code = proc_close($process);
                $result['res'] = $output;
                $result['msg'] = "Command executed using proc_open method";
                return $result;
            }
        }
    }
    return $result;
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using cURL with support for various HTTP methods, custom headers, and JSON response handling.

Function Description: The function should initialize a cURL session, configure it based on input parameters, execute the request, handle errors, process the response, and return a structured result including status, headers, and response body. It should support GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, and OPTIONS methods, with options for custom headers, additional cURL options, JSON response parsing, and timeout configuration.

Input:
- $url (string): The target URL for the HTTP request
- $method (string, optional, default='GET'): HTTP method (GET|POST|PUT|DELETE|PATCH|OPTIONS)
- $data (mixed, optional, default=false): Request payload data
- $headers (mixed, optional, default=false): Request headers (string or array)
- $options (mixed, optional, default=false): Additional cURL options as array
- $json (bool, optional, default=false): Whether to parse response as JSON
- $timeout (int, optional, default=3600): Request timeout in seconds

Output:
Returns an associative array containing:
- 'data': Response body (parsed as array if $json=true and valid JSON)
- 'status': Boolean indicating success (HTTP status 200-299)
- 'code': HTTP status code
- 'header': Parsed response headers as associative array

In case of cURL errors:
- 'data': Error message
- 'code': 0
- 'header': cURL info array
right_result:
<?php
function http_request($url, $method = 'GET', $data = false, $headers = false, $options = false, $json = false, $timeout = 3600) {
    $ch = curl_init();

    // Set URL
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);

    // Set method
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);

    // Set timeout
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $timeout);

    // Set headers
    if ($headers !== false) {
        if (is_array($headers)) {
            foreach ($headers as $name => $value) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, array_merge(curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_HEADER), [$name . ': ' . $value]));
            }
        } else {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [$headers]);
        }
    }

    // Set data for POST/PUT/PATCH
    if ($data !== false) {
        if (is_array($data)) {
            $data = json_encode($data);
        }
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
    }

    // Set additional options
    if ($options !== false) {
        foreach ($options as $key => $value) {
            curl_setopt($ch, $key, $value);
        }
    }

    // Execute request
    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    // Check for cURL errors
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        return [
            'data' => curl_error($ch),
            'code' => 0,
            'header' => curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_HEADER)
        ];
    }

    // Get HTTP status code
    $http_code = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

    // Parse response headers
    $headers_array = [];
    $header_lines = preg_split('/\r\n/', curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_HEADER));
    foreach ($header_lines as $line) {
        if (strpos($line, ':') === false) continue;
        list($name, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
        $headers_array[$name] = $value;
    }

    // Parse response body
    $body = $response;
    if ($json) {
        $body = json_decode($response, true);
        if (json_last_error() === JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            $body = $body;
        } else {
            $body = ['error' => json_last_error_msg()];
        }
    }

    return [
        'data' => $body,
        'status' => $http_code >= 200 && $http_code < 300,
        'code' => $http_code,
        'header' => $headers_array
    ];

    curl_close($ch);
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles interactions with the Alipay payment gateway, specifically for transferring funds to Alipay accounts. The class should handle request signing, HTTP communication, and response processing.

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides functionality to interact with Alipay's fund transfer API. It handles request signing using RSA, constructs proper API requests, and processes responses. The class manages authentication credentials and provides methods for executing fund transfers.

Attributes:
- appId: string - Alipay application ID
- rsaPrivateKey: string - RSA private key for request signing
- alipayRootCertSn: string - Alipay root certificate serial number
- appCertSn: string - Application certificate serial number
- charset: string - Character encoding (default: 'utf-8')

Methods:
- __construct(string $appid, string $saPrivateKey) -> void - Initializes the service with app ID and private key
- setAlipayRootCertSn(string $alipayRootCertSn) -> void - Sets the Alipay root certificate serial number
- setAppCertSn(string $appCertSn) -> void - Sets the application certificate serial number
- doTransfer(float $totalFee, string $outTradeNo, string $account, string $realName, string $remark='') -> array - Executes a fund transfer with given parameters
- curlPost(string $url='', mixed $postData='', array $options=array()) -> string - Sends a POST request using cURL
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType="RSA") -> string - Generates a signature for request parameters
- sign(string $data, string $signType="RSA") -> string - Signs data using RSA
- checkEmpty(mixed $value) -> bool - Checks if a value is empty
- getSignContent(array $params) -> string - Prepares parameters for signing
- characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) -> string - Converts character encoding
right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    public $appId;
    public $rsaPrivateKey;
    public $alipayRootCertSn;
    public $appCertSn;
    public $charset = 'utf-8';

    public function __construct(string $appid, string $saPrivateKey) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $saPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setAlipayRootCertSn(string $alipayRootCertSn) {
        $this->alipayRootCertSn = $alipayRootCertSn;
    }

    public function setAppCertSn(string $appCertSn) {
        $this->appCertSn = $appCertSn;
    }

    public function doTransfer(float $totalFee, string $outTradeNo, string $account, string $realName, string $remark = ''): array {
        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'out_trade_no' => $outTradeNo,
            'total_amount' => $totalFee,
            'product_code' => 'FAST_INSTANT_TRANSFER',
            'account_name' => $realName,
            'account' => $account,
            'remark' => $remark
        ];

        $sign = $this->generateSign($params);
        $params['sign'] = $sign;
        $params['sign_type'] = 'RSA';

        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do';
        $response = $this->curlPost($url, $params);

        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    public function curlPost(string $url = '', mixed $postData = '', array $options = []): string {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

        if (!empty($options)) {
            foreach ($options as $key => $value) {
                curl_setopt($ch, $key, $value);
            }
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    public function generateSign(array $params, string $signType = "RSA"): string {
        $signContent = $this->getSignContent($params);
        return $this->sign($signContent, $signType);
    }

    public function sign(string $data, string $signType = "RSA"): string {
        if ($signType === "RSA") {
            $privateKey = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
            openssl_sign($data, $signature, $privateKey, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
            openssl_free_key($privateKey);
            return base64_encode($signature);
        }
        return '';
    }

    public function checkEmpty(mixed $value): bool {
        return is_null($value) || empty($value);
    }

    public function getSignContent(array $params): string {
        $sortedParams = $this->sortArrayByKeys($params);
        $signStr = http_build_query($sortedParams, '', '&', PHP_QUERY_RFC3986);
        return $this->characet($signStr, $this->charset);
    }

    public function characet(string $data, string $targetCharset): string {
        return mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, 'UTF-8');
    }

    private function sortArrayByKeys(array $array): array {
        $keys = array_keys($array);
        sort($keys);
        $sortedArray = [];
        foreach ($keys as $key) {
            $sortedArray[$key] = $array[$key];
        }
        return $sortedArray;
    }
}

Class Description: The Wechatpay class provides methods for making HTTP requests to WeChat Pay API endpoints. It handles both GET and POST requests, with special consideration for HTTPS connections and SSL configuration. The class includes error handling through HTTP status codes.

Methods:

Method1: http_get(string $url) -> string|false - Performs a GET request to the specified URL. Returns the response content if successful (HTTP 200), or false otherwise.
Method2: http_post(string $url, array $param, bool $post_file=false) -> string|false - Performs a POST request to the specified URL with given parameters. Handles both regular form data and file uploads. Returns the response content if successful (HTTP 200), or false otherwise.
right_result:
<?php
class Wechatpay {
    private $ch;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->ch = curl_init();
    }

    public function http_get(string $url): string|false {
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);
        $response = curl_exec($this->ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($this->ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        if ($httpCode === 200) {
            return $response;
        }
        return false;
    }

    public function http_post(string $url, array $param, bool $post_file = false): string|false {
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
        curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);

        if ($post_file) {
            // Handle file upload
            $postFields = [];
            foreach ($param as $key => $value) {
                if (is_array($value)) {
                    $postFields[$key] = $value;
                } else {
                    $postFields[$key] = $value;
                }
            }
            curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postFields);
        } else {
            // Handle regular form data
            curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($param));
        }

        $response = curl_exec($this->ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($this->ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        if ($httpCode === 200) {
            return $response;
        }
        return false;
    }

    public function __destruct() {
        curl_close($this->ch);
    }
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests to the OpenAI API using cURL, with support for different content types, streaming, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: The OpenAi class is designed to interact with OpenAI's API by sending HTTP requests. It manages API keys, content types, headers, and request configurations. The class supports both JSON and multipart/form-data content types, allows for request streaming, and can be configured to use a proxy.

Attributes:

engine: string - The default OpenAI engine to use (default: "davinci")
model: string - The default model for completions (default: "text-davinci-002")
chatModel: string - The default model for chat completions (default: "gpt-3.5-turbo")
assistantsBetaVersion: string - The version for assistants API (default: "v1")
headers: array - Array of HTTP headers to be sent with requests
contentTypes: array - Mapping of content types to their header strings
timeout: int - cURL timeout in seconds (default: 0)
stream_method: object - Callback method for streaming responses
customUrl: string - Custom base URL to override the default OpenAI API URL
proxy: string - Proxy server address if needed
curlInfo: array - Information about the last cURL request

Methods:

__construct: __construct(string $OPENAI_API_KEY) -> void - Initializes the class with the OpenAI API key and sets default headers
sendRequest: sendRequest(string $url, string $method, array $opts = []) -> bool|string - Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL with given method and options
baseUrl: baseUrl(string &$url) -> void - Modifies the base URL if a custom URL is set
right_result:
<?php
class OpenAi {
    public $engine = "davinci";
    public $model = "text-davinci-002";
    public $chatModel = "gpt-3.5-turbo";
    public $assistantsBetaVersion = "v1";
    public $headers = [];
    public $contentTypes = [
        'json' => 'application/json',
        'multipart/form-data' => 'multipart/form-data'
    ];
    public $timeout = 0;
    public $stream_method = null;
    public $customUrl = null;
    public $proxy = null;
    public $curlInfo = [];

    public function __construct(string $OPENAI_API_KEY) {
        $this->headers[] = "Authorization: Bearer " . $OPENAI_API_KEY;
    }

    public function sendRequest(string $url, string $method, array $opts = []): bool|string {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT_MS, $this->timeout * 1000);

        if ($this->proxy) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy);
        }

        if ($method === 'POST' || $method === 'PUT') {
            if (isset($opts['body'])) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $opts['body']);
            }
        }

        if ($this->stream_method) {
            $this->stream_method($ch);
        }

        foreach ($this->headers as $header) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [$header]);
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->curlInfo = curl_getinfo($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($httpCode >= 400) {
            return false;
        }

        return $response;
    }

    public function baseUrl(string &$url): void {
        if ($this->customUrl) {
            $url = $this->customUrl . $url;
        } else {
            $url = "https://api.openai.com/v1" . $url;
        }
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using cURL for making GET and POST requests, with error handling and resource management.

Class Description: The HttpClient class encapsulates cURL functionality to perform HTTP requests. It includes methods for GET requests, POST requests, and POST requests with download capability. The class handles cURL initialization, option setting, execution, error checking, and resource cleanup.

Methods:

Method1: getCurl(string $url) -> mixed - Performs a GET request to the specified URL and returns the response data. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Method2: postDownloadCurl(string $url, mixed $data) -> array - Performs a POST request with the given data to the specified URL, returns the response as a decoded JSON array. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Method3: postCurl(string $url, mixed $data) -> array - Performs a POST request with the given data to the specified URL, decrypts the response using Faveo private key, and returns it as a decoded JSON array. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Note: All methods include error handling that returns error messages to the caller when exceptions occur. Each method follows proper cURL resource management by initializing, executing, and closing the cURL session.
right_result:
<?php
class HttpClient {
    public function getCurl(string $url): mixed {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new Exception("cURL is not enabled in PHP.");
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            throw new Exception("cURL error: " . curl_error($ch));
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    public function postDownloadCurl(string $url, mixed $data): array {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new Exception("cURL is not enabled in PHP.");
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            throw new Exception("cURL error: " . curl_error($ch));
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    public function postCurl(string $url, mixed $data): array {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new Exception("cURL is not enabled in PHP.");
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            throw new Exception("cURL error: " . curl_error($ch));
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        $decryptedResponse = openssl_decrypt($response, 'AES-256-CBC', 'FaveoPrivateKey', OPENSSL_RAW_DATA, '');
        return json_decode($decryptedResponse, true);
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that downloads a file from a specified URL and saves it to a local file using cURL.

Function Description: The function `http_fetch` uses PHP's cURL library to make an HTTP request to a specified URL and writes the response directly to a local file. It includes custom headers (User-Agent and Referer) to mimic a browser request and handles the cURL session lifecycle properly.

Input:
- `$url` (string): The URL of the resource to download
- `$filename` (string): The local file path where the downloaded content should be saved

Output:
- The function does not explicitly return a value, but it writes the downloaded content to the specified file
- The cURL session information is captured in `$ret` but not returned (could be modified to return this if needed)
right_result:
<?php
function http_fetch($url, $filename) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    $ret = [];

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36');
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_REFERER, 'https://www.example.com');

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $ret['http_code'] = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    $ret['size_download'] = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_SIZE_DOWNLOAD);
    $ret['download_content_type'] = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_CONTENT_TYPE);

    if ($response === false) {
        $ret['error'] = curl_error($ch);
        file_put_contents($filename, '');
    } else {
        file_put_contents($filename, $response);
    }

    curl_close($ch);
    return $ret;
}

<?php
class Notifications_Pushover {
    public $token;
    public $user;
    public static $priorities = [
        'normal' => 'normal',
        'low' => 'low',
        'medium' => 'medium',
        'high' => 'high',
        'urgent' => 'urgent'
    ];

    public function __construct(string $token, string $user) {
        $this->token = $token;
        $this->user = $user;
    }

    public static function getName(): string {
        return "pushover.net";
    }

    public static function getParameters(): array {
        return [
            'token' => 'string',
            'user' => 'string'
        ];
    }

    public function notify(string $message, string $severity = 'info', ?string $event = null): void {
        $priority = self::$priorities[$severity] ?? 'normal';
        $url = "https://api.pushover.net/1/messages.json";
        $data = [
            'token' => $this->token,
            'user' => $this->user,
            'message' => $message,
            'priority' => $priority
        ];
        if ($event !== null) {
            $data['title'] = $event;
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
            'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
        ]);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
    }
}

Task Description: The task involves creating PHP functions to interact with a logistics tracking API (kuaidi100.com) to retrieve shipping company information and tracking data for a given tracking number.

Function Description: The code consists of three functions that work together to:
1. Identify the logistics company from a tracking number
2. Retrieve tracking details for the shipment
3. Generate random IP addresses for request headers

Input: 
- For get_company(): A string representing the tracking number ($text)
- For get_data(): Two strings - tracking number ($text) and company code ($com)
- For Rand_IP(): No input parameters

Output:
- get_company(): Returns a string representing the logistics company code
- get_data(): Returns a JSON string containing the tracking information
- Rand_IP(): Returns a string representing a randomly generated IP address

Methods:
1. get_company($text) -> string - Identifies the logistics company from a tracking number by making an HTTP request to kuaidi100.com's autocomplete API and extracting the company code from the response.
2. get_data($text, $com) -> string - Retrieves tracking details for a given tracking number and company code by making an HTTP request to kuaidi100.com's query API.
3. Rand_IP() -> string - Generates a random IP address to be used in request headers for bypassing potential IP-based restrictions.

Note: The functions use cURL for HTTP requests with specific headers and options, including SSL verification disabled, custom user agent, and random IP addresses in headers to mimic browser requests.
right_result:
<?php
function get_company($text) {
    $url = "http://www.kuaidi100.com/autocomplete?number=" . urlencode($text);
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, Rand_IP());
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    
    $data = json_decode($response, true);
    if (isset($data['result'][0]['company'])) {
        return $data['result'][0]['company'];
    } else {
        return "";
    }
}

function get_data($text, $com) {
    $url = "http://www.kuaidi100.com/query?number=" . urlencode($text) . "&company=" . urlencode($com);
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, Rand_IP());
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    
    return $response;
}

function Rand_IP() {
    $ip = '';
    $parts = array();
    for ($i = 0; $i < 4; $i++) {
        $parts[] = mt_rand(0, 255);
    }
    return implode('.', $parts);
}
?>

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides methods to interact with Alipay's payment API, specifically for querying fund transfer orders. It handles request signing, parameter encoding, and HTTP communication using cURL.

Attributes:
- appId: string - The application ID provided by Alipay
- rsaPrivateKey: string - The RSA private key for request signing
- charset: string - The character encoding to use (default: 'utf-8')

Methods:
- __construct(string $appid, string $saPrivateKey) -> void - Initializes the service with Alipay app ID and private key
- doQuery(string $outBizBo='', string $orderId='') -> array - Queries a fund transfer order using either out business number or order ID
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType='RSA') -> string - Generates a signature for the request parameters
- sign(string $data, string $signType='RSA') -> string - Signs the given data using the configured private key
- checkEmpty(mixed $value) -> bool - Checks if a value is empty or null
- getSignContent(array $params) -> string - Prepares the parameter string for signing
- characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) -> string - Converts character encoding if needed
- curlPost(string $url='', mixed $postData='', array $options=[]) -> string - Executes a POST request using cURL
right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    public $appId;
    public $rsaPrivateKey;
    public $charset = 'utf-8';

    public function __construct(string $appid, string $saPrivateKey) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $saPrivateKey;
    }

    public function doQuery(string $outBizBo = '', string $orderId = '') {
        $params = [];
        if (!empty($outBizBo)) {
            $params['out_biz_no'] = $outBizBo;
        } else {
            $params['out_trade_no'] = $orderId;
        }
        $params['app_id'] = $this->appId;
        $sign = $this->generateSign($params);
        $params['sign'] = $sign;
        $params['sign_type'] = 'RSA';
        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do?';
        $content = $this->curlPost($url, $params);
        return json_decode($content, true);
    }

    public function generateSign(array $params, string $signType = 'RSA') {
        $content = $this->getSignContent($params);
        $content = $this->characet($content, $this->charset);
        return $this->sign($content, $signType);
    }

    public function sign(string $data, string $signType = 'RSA') {
        $privateKey = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
        openssl_sign($data, $signature, $privateKey, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        openssl_free_key($privateKey);
        return base64_encode($signature);
    }

    public function checkEmpty(mixed $value) {
        return is_null($value) || empty($value);
    }

    public function getSignContent(array $params) {
        $pairs = [];
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if (!$this->checkEmpty($v)) {
                $pairs[] = $k . '=' . $v;
            }
        }
        return implode('&', $pairs);
    }

    public function characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) {
        return mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, 'UTF-8');
    }

    public function curlPost(string $url, mixed $postData = '', array $options = []) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, ['Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded']);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using cURL with support for GET/POST methods, custom headers, cookies, and SSL configuration.

Function Description: The function should make HTTP requests to a specified URL with optional cookies and user agent. It should handle both HTTP and HTTPS protocols, with configurable SSL verification. The function should follow redirects (302 status) and return the response data or false on failure. Timeouts should be configurable for connection and request execution.

Input:
- $url: string - The target URL for the HTTP request
- $cookies: string (optional) - Cookie string to be sent with the request
- $useragent: string (optional) - User-Agent header value
- $method: string (optional) - HTTP method ('GET' or 'POST'), defaults to 'GET'

Output:
- Returns: mixed - The response data as string on success (HTTP 200), follows redirects automatically (HTTP 302), or returns false on failure
right_result:
<?php
function http_request($url, $cookies = null, $useragent = null, $method = 'GET') {
    $ch = curl_init();

    // Set URL
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);

    // Set method
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_METHOD, $method);

    // Set user agent
    if ($useragent) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, $useragent);
    }

    // Set cookies
    if ($cookies) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIE, $cookies);
    }

    // Follow redirects
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);

    // Set timeout options
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 10); // Connection timeout
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, 5); // Request timeout

    // Set SSL verification
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false); // Disable SSL verification (can be set to true for production)

    // Return the response as a string instead of outputting it
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);

    // Execute the request
    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    // Check for errors
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        return false;
    }

    // Close the cURL session
    curl_close($ch);

    return $response;
}

<?php
class AlipayService {
    protected $appId;
    protected $notifyUrl;
    protected $charset = 'utf-8';
    protected $rsaPrivateKey;
    protected $totalFee;
    protected $outTradeNo;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->appId = '';
        $this->notifyUrl = '';
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = '';
        $this->totalFee = 0.0;
        $this->outTradeNo = '';
        $this->orderName = '';
    }

    public function setAppid(string $appid) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
    }

    public function setNotifyUrl(string $notifyUrl) {
        $this->notifyUrl = $notifyUrl;
    }

    public function setRsaPrivateKey(string $rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setTotalFee(float $payAmount) {
        $this->totalFee = $payAmount;
    }

    public function setOutTradeNo(string $outTradeNo) {
        $this->outTradeNo = $outTradeNo;
    }

    public function setOrderName(string $orderName) {
        $this->orderName = $orderName;
    }

    public function doPay(): array {
        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'notify_url' => $this->notifyUrl,
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'out_trade_no' => $this->outTradeNo,
            'subject' => $this->orderName,
            'total_amount' => $this->totalFee,
            'product_code' => 'FAST_INSTANT_TRADE_CREATE'
        ];

        $signType = 'RSA2';
        $sign = $this->generateSign($params, $signType);

        $params['sign'] = $sign;
        $params['sign_type'] = $signType;

        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do';
        $response = $this->curlPost($url, $params);

        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    protected function curlPost(string $url, mixed $postData, array $options = []): string {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

        if (!empty($options)) {
            foreach ($options as $key => $value) {
                curl_setopt($ch, $key, $value);
            }
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        return $response;
    }

    protected function generateSign(array $params, string $signType): string {
        // Implementation of signature generation using RSA2
        // This is a placeholder for the actual implementation
        $privateKey = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
        openssl_sign(implode('&', $params), $signature, $privateKey, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        openssl_free_key($privateKey);

        return base64_encode($signature);
    }
}
