Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP HTTP client class that handles various types of HTTP requests (GET, POST, DELETE, multipart POST) using cURL, with proper error handling and response processing.

Class Description: The Client class provides static methods to send HTTP requests and process responses. It handles request construction, cURL session management, response parsing, and error handling. The class supports standard HTTP methods and multipart form data for file uploads.

Attributes: (This class has no instance attributes as all methods are static)

Methods:

Method1: get(string $url, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a GET request to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method2: delete(string $url, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a DELETE request to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method3: post(string $url, mixed $body, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a POST request with the given body to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method4: multipartPost(string $url, array $fields, string $name, string $fileName, string $fileBody, string $mimeType = null, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a multipart/form-data POST request for file upload with additional form fields.

Method5: sendRequest(Request $request) -> Response - Internal method that executes the cURL request and returns a Response object. Handles request setup, execution, and response processing.

Method6: userAgent() -> string - Generates a User-Agent string with SDK, system, and PHP version information.

Method7: parseHeaders(string $raw) -> array - Parses raw HTTP response headers into an associative array.

Method8: escapeQuotes(string $str) -> string - Escapes quotes in a string for use in HTTP headers.

Method9: ucwordsHyphen(string $str) -> string - Properly capitalizes hyphenated header names.
right_result:
<?php
class Client {
    public static function get(string $url, array $headers = array()) : Response {
        return self::sendRequest(new Request('GET', $url, $headers));
    }

    public static function delete(string $url, array $headers = array()) : Response {
        return self::sendRequest(new Request('DELETE', $url, $headers));
    }

    public static function post(string $url, mixed $body, array $headers = array()) : Response {
        return self::sendRequest(new Request('POST', $url, $headers, $body));
    }

    public static function multipartPost(string $url, array $fields, string $name, string $fileName, string $fileBody, string $mimeType = null, array $headers = array()) : Response {
        $boundary = uniqid('---');
        $postFields = '';
        
        foreach ($fields as $key => $value) {
            $postFields .= "--$boundary\nContent-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$key\"\n\n$value\n";
        }
        
        $postFields .= "--$boundary\nContent-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$name\"; filename=\"$fileName\"\nContent-Type: $mimeType\n\n$fileBody\n--$boundary--\n";
        
        return self::sendRequest(new Request('POST', $url, $headers, $postFields));
    }

    protected static function sendRequest(Request $request) : Response {
        $ch = curl_init();
        
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $request->getUrl());
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, self::prepareHeaders($request->getHeaders()));
        
        if ($request->getMethod() === 'POST') {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $request->getBody());
        } elseif ($request->getMethod() === 'DELETE') {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'DELETE');
        }
        
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        
        if ($response === false) {
            throw new Exception('cURL error: ' . curl_error($ch));
        }
        
        $headerSize = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        $headers = substr($response, 0, $headerSize);
        $body = substr($response, $headerSize);
        
        $responseCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        
        curl_close($ch);
        
        return new Response($responseCode, self::parseHeaders($headers), $body);
    }

    protected static function prepareHeaders(array $headers) : array {
        $preparedHeaders = [];
        
        foreach ($headers as $name => $value) {
            $preparedHeaders[] = self::escapeQuotes(self::ucwordsHyphen($name)) . ': ' . self::escapeQuotes($value);
        }
        
        return $preparedHeaders;
    }

    public static function userAgent() : string {
        $os = php_uname('s') . ' ' . php_uname('r') . ' ' . php_uname('m');
        $phpVersion = PHP_VERSION;
        return "SDK/1.0 + (http://example.com $os; PHP $phpVersion)";
    }

    protected static function parseHeaders(string $raw) : array {
        $headers = [];
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $raw);
        
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (empty($line)) {
                continue;
            }
            
            list($name, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
            $headers[$name] = $value;
        }
        
        return $headers;
    }

    protected static function escapeQuotes(string $str) : string {
        return str_replace(['"', "'"], ['\\"', "\'"], $str);
    }

    protected static function ucwordsHyphen(string $str) : string {
        return str_replace('-', ' ', $str);
    }
}

class Request {
    private $method;
    private $url;
    private $headers;
    private $body;

    public function __construct(string $method, string $url, array $headers = array(), mixed $body = null) {
        $this->method = $method;
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->headers = $headers;
        $this->body = $body;
    }

    public function getMethod() : string {
        return $this->method;
    }

    public function getUrl() : string {
        return $this->url;
    }

    public function getHeaders() : array {
        return $this->headers;
    }

    public function getBody() : mixed {
        return $this->body;
    }
}

class Response {
    private $statusCode;
    private $headers;
    private $body;

    public function __construct(int $statusCode, array $headers, string $body) {
        $this->statusCode = $statusCode;
        $this->headers = $headers;
        $this->body = $body;
    }

    public functiongetStatusCode() : int {
        return $this->statusCode;
    }

    public function getHeaders() : array {
        return $this->headers;
    }

    public functiongetBody() : string {
        return $this->body;
    }
}

  - $paymentKeys (array): Contains API keys for different payment gateways
  - $amount (numeric): Transaction amount to verify
  - $payid (string): Transaction ID from NextPay

- verify_zarinpal_transaction:
  - $paymentKeys (array): Contains API keys for different payment gateways
  - $Authority (string): Transaction authority code from ZarinPal
  - $amount (numeric): Transaction amount to verify

<?php
function verify_nowpayment_transaction($paymentKeys, $hash_id) {
    $apiKey = $paymentKeys['nowpayments'];
    $url = "https://api.nowpayments.io/v1/transactions/$hash_id/verify";
    $headers = [
        "Authorization: Bearer $apiKey",
        "Content-Type: application/json"
    ];
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    return json_decode($response);
}

function verify_nextpay_transaction($paymentKeys, $amount, $payid) {
    $apiKey = $paymentKeys['nextpay'];
    $url = "https://api.nextpay.com/transaction/$payid/verify";
    $headers = [
        "Authorization: Bearer $apiKey",
        "Content-Type: application/json"
    ];
    $data = [
        "amount" => $amount
    ];
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($data));
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    return json_decode($response);
}

function verify_zarinpal_transaction($paymentKeys, $authority, $amount) {
    $apiKey = $paymentKeys['zarinpal'];
    $url = "https://api.zarinpal.com/Transaction/Verification";
    $headers = [
        "Content-Type: application/json"
    ];
    $data = [
        "MerchantID" => $apiKey,
        "Authority" => $authority,
        "Amount" => $amount
    ];
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($data));
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    return json_decode($response);
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements OAuth 1.0 authentication for interacting with the Twitter API, handling both GET and POST requests with proper parameter encoding and signature generation.

Class Description: TwitterAPIExchange is a PHP class that provides a convenient way to interact with Twitter's API using OAuth 1.0 authentication. It handles the construction of OAuth signatures, request headers, and performs HTTP requests using cURL.

Attributes:
- oauth_access_token: string - Twitter OAuth access token
- oauth_access_token_secret: string - Twitter OAuth access token secret
- consumer_key: string - Twitter API consumer key
- consumer_secret: string - Twitter API consumer secret
- postfields: array - Data to be sent in POST requests
- getfield: string - Query string for GET requests
- oauth: array - OAuth parameters for request signing
- url: string - API endpoint URL

Methods:
- __construct(array $settings) -> void - Constructor that validates and sets OAuth credentials
- setPostfields(array $array) -> self - Sets POST data and returns instance for method chaining
- setGetfield(string $string) -> self - Sets GET query string and returns instance for method chaining
- getGetfield() -> string|null - Returns current GET query string
- getPostfields() -> array|null - Returns current POST data
- buildOauth(string $url, string $requestMethod) -> self - Builds OAuth signature and parameters
- performRequest(bool $return = true) -> string|void - Executes the API request and returns response
- buildBaseString(string $baseURI, string $method, array $params) -> string - Private method to build base string for signature
- buildAuthorizationHeader(array $oauth) -> string - Private method to build OAuth header
right_result:
<?php
class TwitterAPIExchange {
    public $oauth_access_token;
    public $oauth_access_token_secret;
    public $consumer_key;
    public $consumer_secret;
    public $postfields;
    public $getfield;
    public $oauth;
    public $url;

    public function __construct(array $settings) {
        if (!isset($settings['oauth_access_token'])) {
            throw new Exception("OAuth access token is required.");
        }
        if (!isset($settings['oauth_access_token_secret'])) {
            throw new Exception("OAuth access token secret is required.");
        }
        if (!isset($settings['consumer_key'])) {
            throw new Exception("Consumer key is required.");
        }
        if (!isset($settings['consumer_secret'])) {
            throw new Exception("Consumer secret is required.");
        }
        $this->oauth_access_token = $settings['oauth_access_token'];
        $this->oauth_access_token_secret = $settings['oauth_access_token_secret'];
        $this->consumer_key = $settings['consumer_key'];
        $this->consumer_secret = $settings['consumer_secret'];
    }

    public function setPostfields(array $array) {
        $this->postfields = $array;
        return $this;
    }

    public function setGetfield(string $string) {
        $this->getfield = $string;
        return $this;
    }

    public function getGetfield() {
        return $this->getfield;
    }

    public function getPostfields() {
        return $this->postfields;
    }

    public function buildOauth(string $url, string $requestMethod) {
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->oauth = array(
            'oauth_consumer_key' => $this->consumer_key,
            'oauth_nonce' => self::generateNonce(),
            'oauth_signature_method' => 'HMAC-SHA1',
            'oauth_timestamp' => time(),
            'oauth_token' => $this->oauth_access_token,
            'oauth_version' => '1.0'
        );

        if ($requestMethod === 'GET') {
            $params = $this->parseGetParams($url);
            $this->oauth += $params;
        } else {
            $this->oauth += $this->postfields;
        }

        $this->oauth['oauth_signature'] = self::buildOAuthSignature($this->oauth, $this->consumer_secret, $this->oauth_access_token_secret);
        return $this;
    }

    public function performRequest(bool $return = true) {
        $headers = $this->buildAuthorizationHeader($this->oauth);
        $curl = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
            CURLOPT_URL => $this->url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => $return,
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array($headers),
            CURLOPT_POST => ($this->postfields !== null),
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => ($this->postfields !== null) ? http_build_query($this->postfields) : ''
        ));
        $response = curl_exec($curl);
        curl_close($curl);
        return $return ? $response : true;
    }

    private function buildBaseString(string $baseURI, string $method, array $params) {
        $params = $this->sortParams($params);
        $baseString = $method . '&' . rawurlencode($baseURI) . '&' . rawurlencode($this->buildQueryString($params));
        return $baseString;
    }

    private function buildQueryString(array $params) {
        $parts = array();
        foreach ($params as $key => $value) {
            $parts[] = rawurlencode($key) . '=' . rawurlencode($value);
        }
        return implode('&', $parts);
    }

    private function sortParams(array $params) {
        ksort($params);
        return $params;
    }

    private function buildAuthorizationHeader(array $oauth) {
        $params = $this->sortParams($oauth);
        $header = 'Authorization: OAuth ' . $this->buildAuthorizationHeaderString($params);
        return $header;
    }

    private function buildAuthorizationHeaderString(array $params) {
        $parts = array();
        foreach ($params as $key => $value) {
            $parts[] = rawurlencode($key) . '="' . rawurlencode($value) . '"';
        }
        return implode(', ', $parts);
    }

    private static function generateNonce() {
        return md5(uniqid(mt_rand(), true));
    }

    private static function buildOAuthSignature(array $oauth, string $consumer_secret, string $token_secret) {
        $baseString = self::buildBaseString($oauth['oauth_url'], 'GET', $oauth);
        $key = rawurlencode($consumer_secret) . '&' . rawurlencode($token_secret);
        $signature = base64_encode(hash_hmac('sha1', $baseString, $key, true));
        return $signature;
    }

    private function parseGetParams(string $url) {
        $parsedUrl = parse_url($url);
        if (isset($parsedUrl['query'])) {
            $params = parse_str($parsedUrl['query']);
            return $params;
        }
        return array();
    }
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes an HTTP request to the OpenAI API using cURL, handles the response, and manages potential errors.

Function Description: The function `make_curl_request` initializes a cURL session to interact with the OpenAI API. It sets necessary headers including authentication, configures cURL options for the request, and implements a callback function to handle the response stream. The function processes both successful responses and errors, setting appropriate cookies for error conditions and returning the response data.

Input:
- `$postData` (string) - The JSON-encoded data to be sent in the POST request body.
- `$OPENAI_API_KEY` (string) - The API key for authenticating with the OpenAI API.

Output:
- `$responsedata` (string) - The raw response data from the API, which could be either a successful response or an error message. The function also sets cookies for error conditions when they occur.
right_result:
<?php
function make_curl_request($postData, $OPENAI_API_KEY) {
    $ch = curl_init();

    $headers = [
        'Content-Type: application/json',
        'Authorization: Bearer ' . $OPENAI_API_KEY
    ];

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, 'https://api.openai.com/v1/completions');
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        $error_msg = curl_error($ch);
        setcookie('error', $error_msg, time() + 3600, '/');
        return $error_msg;
    }

    $http_code = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

    if ($http_code === 200) {
        setcookie('error', '', time() - 3600, '/');
        return $response;
    } else {
        $error_msg = 'API Error: ' . $http_code . ' - ' . $response;
        setcookie('error', $error_msg, time() + 3600, '/');
        return $error_msg;
    }

    curl_close($ch);
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using Guzzle library, with error handling and testing capabilities.

Class Description: The `SupportedApps` class is an abstract base class that provides HTTP client functionality using Guzzle. It handles HTTP requests with configurable timeouts and methods, includes error handling for connection and server exceptions, and provides a testing method to verify API connectivity.

Attributes:

Methods:

right_result:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\ConnectException;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;
use GuzzleHttp\PsrHttpMessage\ResponseInterface;

abstract class SupportedApps
{
    protected $jar = false;
    protected $method = 'GET';
    protected $error = null;

    public function __construct()
    {
        $this->client = new Client([
            'timeout' => 10,
        ]);
    }

    public function execute($url, array $attrs = [], $overridevars = null, $overridemethod = null)
    {
        $this->error = null;

        $method = $overridemethod ?? $this->method;
        $query = [];

        if (!empty($attrs)) {
            foreach ($attrs as $key => $value) {
                $query[$key] = $value;
            }
        }

        try {
            $response = $this->client->request($method, $url, [
                'query' => $query,
                'headers' => ['Content-Type' => 'application/json'],
                'http_errors' => false
            ]);

            return $response;
        } catch (ConnectException $e) {
            $this->error = "Connection failed: " . $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            $this->error = "Request failed: " . $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            $this->error = "Unexpected error: " . $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public function appTest($url, array $attrs = [])
    {
        $response = $this->execute($url, $attrs);

        if (!$response) {
            return (object) [
                'status_code' => 500,
                'status_message' => 'Internal Server Error',
                'response_body' => $this->error
            ];
        }

        $statusCode = $response->getStatusCode();
        $statusMessage = $response->getReasonPhrase();

        switch ($statusCode) {
            case 200:
                return (object) [
                    'status_code' => 200,
                    'status_message' => 'OK',
                    'response_body' => (string)$response->getBody()
                ];
            case 400:
                return (object) [
                    'status_code' => 400,
                    'status_message' => 'Bad Request',
                    'response_body' => (string)$response->getBody()
                ];
            case 401:
                return (object) [
                    'status_code' => 401,
                    'status_message' => 'Unauthorized',
                    'response_body' => (string)$response->getBody()
                ];
            case 403:
                return (object) [
                    'status_code' => 403,
                    'status_message' => 'Forbidden',
                    'response_body' => (string)$response->getBody()
                ];
            case 404:
                return (object) [
                    'status_code' => 404,
                    'status_message' => 'Not Found',
                    'response_body' => (string)$response->getBody()
                ];
            case 500:
                return (object) [
                    'status_code' => 500,
                    'status_message' => 'Internal Server Error',
                    'response_body' => (string)$response->getBody()
                ];
            default:
                return (object) [
                    'status_code' => $statusCode,
                    'status_message' => 'Unknown Status',
                    'response_body' => (string)$response->getBody()
                ];
        }
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class for interacting with Alipay's API to send red packets (digital cash gifts) with proper authentication and request handling.

Class Description: The AlipayService class encapsulates functionality for sending red packets through Alipay's payment platform. It handles request configuration, signature generation, and API communication while maintaining security through proper certificate and key management.

Attributes:
- appId: [string] - Alipay application ID
- alipayRootCertSn: [string] - Alipay root certificate serial number  
- appCertSn: [string] - Application certificate serial number
- notifyUrl: [string] - Callback URL for payment notifications
- charset: [string] - Character encoding (default: utf-8)
- rsaPrivateKey: [string] - RSA private key for signing requests
- totalFee: [float] - Payment amount
- outTradeNo: [string] - Merchant transaction number
- orderName: [string] - Order description
- userid: [string] - Recipient's Alipay user ID

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the class with default charset
- setAppid(string $appid) -> [void] - Sets the Alipay application ID
- setAlipayRootCertSn(string $alipayRootCertSn) -> [void] - Sets root certificate serial number
- setAppCertSn(string $appCertSn) -> [void] - Sets application certificate serial number  
- setNotifyUrl(string $notifyUrl) -> [void] - Sets notification callback URL
- setRsaPrivateKey(string $saPrivateKey) -> [void] - Sets RSA private key
- setTotalFee(float $payAmount) -> [void] - Sets payment amount
- setOutTradeNo(string $outTradeNo) -> [void] - Sets merchant transaction number
- setOrderName(string $orderName) -> [void] - Sets order description
- setUserId(string $userid) -> [void] - Sets recipient's Alipay user ID
- sendRedPacket() -> [array] - Sends red packet request and returns response
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType) -> [string] - Generates request signature
- sign(string $data, string $signType) -> [string] - Creates cryptographic signature

- getSignContent(array $params) -> [string] - Prepares string for signing
- characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) -> [string] - Handles character encoding

right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    protected $appId;
    protected $alipayRootCertSn;
    protected $appCertSn;
    protected $notifyUrl;
    protected $charset = 'utf-8';
    protected $rsaPrivateKey;
    protected $totalFee;
    protected $outTradeNo;
    protected $orderName;
    protected $userid;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->appId = '';
        $this->alipayRootCertSn = '';
        $this->appCertSn = '';
        $this->notifyUrl = '';
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = '';
        $this->totalFee = 0.0;
        $this->outTradeNo = '';
        $this->orderName = '';
        $this->userid = '';
    }

    public function setAppid(string $appid) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
    }

    public function setAlipayRootCertSn(string $alipayRootCertSn) {
        $this->alipayRootCertSn = $alipayRootCertSn;
    }

    public function setAppCertSn(string $appCertSn) {
        $this->appCertSn = $appCertSn;
    }

    public function setNotifyUrl(string $notifyUrl) {
        $this->notifyUrl = $notifyUrl;
    }

    public function setRsaPrivateKey(string $rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setTotalFee(float $payAmount) {
        $this->totalFee = $payAmount;
    }

    public function setOutTradeNo(string $outTradeNo) {
        $this->outTradeNo = $outTradeNo;
    }

    public function setOrderName(string $orderName) {
        $this->orderName = $orderName;
    }

    public function setUserId(string $userid) {
        $this->userid = $userid;
    }

    public function sendRedPacket() {
        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'alipay_root_cert_sn' => $this->alipayRootCertSn,
            'app_cert_sn' => $this->appCertSn,
            'notify_url' => $this->notifyUrl,
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA2',
            'total_fee' => $this->totalFee,
            'out_trade_no' => $this->outTradeNo,
            'subject' => $this->orderName,
            'user_id' => $this->userid
        ];

        $sign = $this->generateSign($params, 'RSA2');
        $params['sign'] = $sign;

        $response = $this->curlPost('https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do', $params);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    public function generateSign(array $params, string $signType) {
        $content = $this->getSignContent($params);
        return $this->sign($content, $signType);
    }

    public function sign(string $data, string $signType) {
        $privateKey = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
        openssl_sign($data, $signature, $privateKey, $signType);
        openssl_free_key($privateKey);
        return base64_encode($signature);
    }

    public function checkEmpty(mixed $value) {
        return is_null($value) || empty($value);
    }

    public function getSignContent(array $params) {
        $sortedParams = $this->sortArray($params);
        $content = http_build_query($sortedParams);
        return $content;
    }

    public function characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) {
        return mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, 'UTF-8');
    }

    public function curlPost(string $url, mixed $postData, array $options = []) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    private function sortArray(array $array) {
        ksort($array);
        return $array;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP HTTP client class that handles various types of HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, multipart POST) using cURL, with proper error handling and response processing.

Class Description: The Client class provides static methods to send HTTP requests and process responses. It handles request construction, cURL session management, response parsing, and error handling.

Attributes: (This class has no instance attributes as all methods are static)

Methods:

1. get(string $url, array $headers = array()) -> Response
   - Sends a GET request to the specified URL with optional headers
   - Returns a Response object containing status code, headers, body, and timing information

2. delete(string $url, array $headers = array()) -> Response
   - Sends a DELETE request to the specified URL with optional headers
   - Returns a Response object

3. post(string $url, mixed $body, array $headers = array()) -> Response
   - Sends a POST request with body content to the specified URL
   - Returns a Response object

4. put(string $url, mixed $body, array $headers = array()) -> Response
   - Sends a PUT request with body content to the specified URL
   - Returns a Response object

5. multipartPost(
     string $url,
     array $fields,
     string $name,
     string $fileName,
     string $fileBody,
     string $mimeType = null,
     array $headers = array()
   ) -> Response
   - Sends a multipart/form-data POST request with file upload
   - Returns a Response object

6. sendRequest(Request $request) -> Response
   - Internal method that executes the cURL request
   - Handles cURL initialization, option setting, execution, and cleanup
   - Returns a Response object with request results

7. userAgent() -> string
   - Generates a User-Agent string with SDK, system, and PHP version information
   - Returns the formatted User-Agent string

8. parseHeaders(string $raw) -> array
   - Parses raw HTTP response headers into an associative array
   - Returns array of headers with normalized keys

9. escapeQuotes(string $str) -> string
   - Escapes quotes in a string for use in multipart form data
   - Returns the escaped string

10. ucwordsHyphen(string $str) -> string
    - Converts hyphenated header names to proper case (e.g., 'content-type' becomes 'Content-Type')
    - Returns the properly cased string
right_result:
<?php

class Response {
    public $statusCode;
    public $headers;
    public $body;
    public $timing;

    public function __construct($statusCode, $headers, $body, $timing) {
        $this->statusCode = $statusCode;
        $this->headers = $headers;
        $this->body = $body;
        $this->timing = $timing;
    }
}

class Client {
    public static function get(string $url, array $headers = []): Response {
        return self::sendRequest(new Request('GET', $url, $headers));
    }

    public static function delete(string $url, array $headers = []): Response {
        return self::sendRequest(new Request('DELETE', $url, $headers));
    }

    public static function post(string $url, mixed $body, array $headers = []): Response {
        return self::sendRequest(new Request('POST', $url, $headers, $body));
    }

    public static function put(string $url, mixed $body, array $headers = []): Response {
        return self::sendRequest(new Request('PUT', $url, $headers, $body));
    }

    public static function multipartPost(
        string $url,
        array $fields,
        string $name,
        string $fileName,
        string $fileBody,
        string $mimeType = null,
        array $headers = []
    ): Response {
        $boundary = '---------------------------' . bin2hex(random_bytes(16));
        $postFields = '';
        foreach ($fields as $key => $value) {
            $postFields .= "--$boundary\r\nContent-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$key\"\r\n\r\n$value\r\n";
        }
        $postFields .= "--$boundary\r\nContent-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$name\"; filename=\"$fileName\"\r\nContent-Type: $mimeType\r\n\r\n$fileBody\r\n--$boundary--\r\n";
        
        $curlOptions = [
            CURLOPT_URL => $url,
            CURLOPT_POST => true,
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => $postFields,
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $headers,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_HEADER => true,
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => false
        ];
        
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($ch, $curlOptions);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $headersSize = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        $body = substr($response, $headersSize);
        $headers = self::parseHeaders(substr($response, 0, $headersSize));
        $timing = [
            'start' => microtime(true),
            'end' => microtime(true),
            'duration' => $timing['end'] - $timing['start']
        ];
        
        curl_close($ch);
        
        return new Response($httpCode, $headers, $body, $timing);
    }

    protected static function sendRequest(Request $request): Response {
        $curlOptions = [
            CURLOPT_URL => $request->url,
            CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => $request->method,
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $request->headers,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_HEADER => true,
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => false
        ];

        if ($request->method === 'POST' || $request->method === 'PUT') {
            $curlOptions[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = $request->body;
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($ch, $curlOptions);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $headersSize = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        $body = substr($response, $headersSize);
        $headers = self::parseHeaders(substr($response, 0, $headersSize));
        $timing = [
            'start' => microtime(true),
            'end' => microtime(true),
            'duration' => $timing['end'] - $timing['start']
        ];

        curl_close($ch);

        return new Response($httpCode, $headers, $body, $timing);
    }

    public static function userAgent(): string {
        $sdk = 'PHP-SDK';
        $system = php_uname('s');
        $phpVersion = PHP_VERSION;
        return "$sdk/$system/$phpVersion";
    }

    protected static function parseHeaders(string $raw): array {
        $headers = [];
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $raw);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (empty($line)) continue;
            $parts = explode(':', $line, 2);
            if (count($parts) < 2) continue;
            $name = self::ucwordsHyphen($parts[0]);
            $value = implode(':', array_slice($parts, 1));
            $headers[$name] = $value;
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    protected static function escapeQuotes(string $str): string {
        return str_replace('"', '\"', $str);
    }

    protected static function ucwordsHyphen(string $str): string {
        return ucwords(str_replace('-', ' ', $str));
    }
}

class Request {
    public $method;
    public $url;
    public $headers;
    public $body;

    public function __construct(string $method, string $url, array $headers = [], $body = null) {
        $this->method = $method;
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->headers = $headers;
        $this->body = $body;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that uploads a file to a cloud storage service using cURL with PUT method, including authentication and proper headers.

Function Description: The function `dogcloud_upload` uploads a specified file to DogeCloud's object storage service. It handles authentication using HMAC-SHA1, sets appropriate headers including content type, and manages the file upload via HTTP PUT request. The function checks file existence before proceeding with the upload.

Input:
- $object (string): The target path/name for the uploaded file in the cloud storage
- $file (string): Local path to the file to be uploaded
- $mime (string): MIME type of the file being uploaded

Output:
- Returns the API response on successful upload (string)
- Returns false if the file doesn't exist or if upload fails (boolean)
right_result:
<?php
function dogcloud_upload($object, $file, $mime) {
    if (!file_exists($file)) {
        return false;
    }

    $access_key = 'your_access_key'; // Replace with actual access key
    $secret_key = 'your_secret_key'; // Replace with actual secret key
    $bucket = 'your_bucket_name'; // Replace with actual bucket name

    $url = "https://$bucket.dogecloud.com/$object";

    $date = date('Ymd\THis\Z');
    $string_to_sign = "PUT\n$content_type\n$date\n/$object";
    $signature = base64_encode(hash_hmac('sha1', $string_to_sign, $secret_key, true));

    $headers = [
        'Date: ' . $date,
        'Authorization: DogeCloud $access_key:$signature',
        'Content-Type: ' . $mime
    ];

    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PUT, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_INFILE, fopen($file, 'r'));
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_INFILESIZE, filesize($file));
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);

    return $response;
}
?>

Task Description: Implement a file downloader class in PHP that supports both regular and resumable downloads using either fopen or cURL, with proper error handling and support for gzip-compressed files.

Class Description: The Downloader class provides functionality to download files from URLs with support for resuming interrupted downloads. It handles both HTTP and HTTPS protocols, checks for server-side range support, and manages temporary files during download.

Attributes: (This class doesn't have explicit attributes as it uses static methods)

Methods:

Method1: start(string|array $url, string $saveFile, int $timeout = 10) -> array - Main entry point that initiates the download process. Checks URL validity and determines the best download method (fopen or cURL) based on server capabilities.

Method2: fileDownloadFopen(string $url, string $fileName, int $headerSize = 0) -> array - Downloads a file using PHP's fopen function. Handles basic downloads when range requests aren't supported.

Method3: fileDownloadCurl(string $url, string $fileName, bool $supportRange = false, int $existsLength = 0, int $length = 0) -> array - Downloads a file using cURL with support for resumable downloads if the server supports range requests.

Method4: checkGzip(string $file) -> void - Checks if a file is gzip-compressed and decompresses it if necessary. This is an internal helper method.
right_result:
<?php
class Downloader {
    public function start(string $url, string $saveFile, int $timeout = 10): array {
        if (!filter_var($url, FILTER_VALIDATE_URL)) {
            return ['error' => 'Invalid URL'];
        }

        $headers = get_headers($url, 1);
        $supportsRange = false;
        $contentLength = 0;

        foreach ($headers as $header) {
            if (stripos($header, 'Content-Range') !== false) {
                $supportsRange = true;
            }
            if (stripos($header, 'Content-Length') !== false) {
                $contentLength = (int) preg_replace('/[^0-9]/', '', $header);
            }
        }

        $fileSize = filesize($saveFile);
        $existsLength = $fileSize > 0 ? $fileSize : 0;

        if ($supportsRange && $existsLength < $contentLength) {
            return $this->fileDownloadCurl($url, $saveFile, true, $existsLength, $contentLength);
        } else {
            return $this->fileDownloadFopen($url, $saveFile);
        }
    }

    public function fileDownloadFopen(string $url, string $fileName, int $headerSize = 0): array {
        $file = fopen($fileName, 'wb');
        if (!$file) {
            return ['error' => 'Could not open file for writing'];
        }

        $context = stream_context_create([
            'http' => [
                'method' => 'GET',
                'header' => "Accept-encoding: gzip",
                'timeout' => 10
            ]
        ]);

        $response = file_get_contents($url, false, $context, $headerSize);
        if ($response === false) {
            fclose($file);
            return ['error' => 'Failed to download file'];
        }

        fwrite($file, $response);
        fclose($file);

        return ['success' => true, 'file' => $fileName];
    }

    public function fileDownloadCurl(string $url, string $fileName, bool $supportRange = false, int $existsLength = 0, int $length = 0): array {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 10);

        if ($supportRange) {
            $range = 'bytes=' . $existsLength . '-' . ($existsLength + $length - 1);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RANGE, $range);
        }

        $headers = [];
        $headerSize = 0;
        $response = '';

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, function ($ch, $header) use (&$headers, &$headerSize) {
            $headers[] = $header;
            $headerSize += strlen($header);
            return strlen($header);
        });

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if ($response === false) {
            curl_close($ch);
            return ['error' => 'cURL error: ' . curl_error($ch)];
        }

        $httpCode = intval(substr($response, 0, 3));
        $body = substr($response, $headerSize);

        if ($httpCode === 206) {
            $contentRange = substr($headers[0], strpos($headers[0], 'Content-Range') + 14);
            list(, $start, $end) = explode('-', $contentRange);
            $downloaded = $end - $start + 1;
        } else {
            $downloaded = strlen($body);
        }

        $file = fopen($fileName, 'ab');
        if (!$file) {
            curl_close($ch);
            return ['error' => 'Could not open file for writing'];
        }

        fwrite($file, $body);
        fclose($file);

        curl_close($ch);

        return ['success' => true, 'file' => $fileName];
    }

    public function checkGzip(string $file): void {
        if (file_exists($file) && is_file($file)) {
            $compressed = gzdecode(file_get_contents($file));
            if ($compressed !== false) {
                file_put_contents($file, $compressed);
            }
        }
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles interactions with the Alipay API, specifically for processing settlements and generating required signatures for secure communication.

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides functionality to interact with Alipay's payment gateway, focusing on settlement operations. It handles request configuration, signature generation, and HTTP communication using cURL.

Attributes:
- appId: [string] - The application ID for Alipay API
- charset: [string] - Character encoding (default: 'utf-8')
- notifyUrl: [string] - Notification URL for callbacks
- rsaPrivateKey: [string] - RSA private key for signing requests
- totalFee: [float] - Total amount for the transaction
- outTradeNo: [string] - Merchant's unique order number
- orderName: [string] - Description of the order
- tradeNo: [string] - Alipay's transaction number
- tranOut: [string] - Account transferring funds
- tranIn: [string] - Account receiving funds
- amountPercentage: [float] - Percentage of amount to transfer

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the class with default charset
- setAppid($appid) -> [void] - Sets the Alipay application ID
- setTradeNo($tradeNo) -> [void] - Sets the Alipay transaction number
- setTranOut($tranOut) -> [void] - Sets the transferring account
- setTranIn($tranIn) -> [void] - Sets the receiving account
- setRsaPrivateKey($rsaPrivateKey) -> [void] - Sets the RSA private key
- setTotalFee($payAmount) -> [void] - Sets the transaction amount
- setOutTradeNo($outTradeNo) -> [void] - Sets the merchant order number
- doSettle() -> [array] - Executes the settlement request to Alipay
- generateSign($params, $signType = "RSA") -> [string] - Generates signature for request
- sign($data, $signType = "RSA") -> [string] - Creates RSA signature
- checkEmpty($value) -> [bool] - Checks if a value is empty
- getSignContent($params) -> [string] - Prepares content for signing
- characet($data, $targetCharset) -> [string] - Handles character encoding conversion
- curlPost($url = '', $postData = '', $options = array()) -> [string] - Executes HTTP POST request using cURL
right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    public $appId;
    public $charset = 'utf-8';
    public $notifyUrl;
    public $rsaPrivateKey;
    public $totalFee;
    public $outTradeNo;
    public $orderName;
    public $tradeNo;
    public $tranOut;
    public $tranIn;
    public $amountPercentage;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->appId = '';
        $this->notifyUrl = '';
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = '';
        $this->totalFee = 0.0;
        $this->outTradeNo = '';
        $this->orderName = '';
        $this->tradeNo = '';
        $this->tranOut = '';
        $this->tranIn = '';
        $this->amountPercentage = 0.0;
    }

    public function setAppid($appid) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
    }

    public function setTradeNo($tradeNo) {
        $this->tradeNo = $tradeNo;
    }

    public function setTranOut($tranOut) {
        $this->tranOut = $tranOut;
    }

    public function setTranIn($tranIn) {
        $this->tranIn = $tranIn;
    }

    public function setRsaPrivateKey($rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setTotalFee($payAmount) {
        $this->totalFee = $payAmount;
    }

    public function setOutTradeNo($outTradeNo) {
        $this->outTradeNo = $outTradeNo;
    }

    public function doSettle() {
        $params = array(
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'notify_url' => $this->notifyUrl,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA',
            'total_fee' => $this->totalFee,
            'out_trade_no' => $this->outTradeNo,
            'subject' => $this->orderName,
            'trade_no' => $this->tradeNo,
            'tran_out' => $this->tranOut,
            'tran_in' => $this->tranIn,
            'amount_percentage' => $this->amountPercentage
        );

        $sign = $this->generateSign($params);
        $params['sign'] = $sign;

        $postData = http_build_query($params);
        return $this->curlPost('https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do', $postData);
    }

    public function generateSign($params, $signType = "RSA") {
        $content = $this->getSignContent($params);
        return $this->sign($content, $signType);
    }

    public function sign($data, $signType = "RSA") {
        if ($signType === "RSA") {
            $privateKey = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
            openssl_sign($data, $signature, $privateKey, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
            openssl_free_key($privateKey);
            return base64_encode($signature);
        }
        return '';
    }

    public function checkEmpty($value) {
        return empty($value);
    }

    public function getSignContent($params) {
        $content = '';
        foreach ($params as $key => $value) {
            if (!$this->checkEmpty($value)) {
                $content .= $key . '=' . $value . '&';
            }
        }
        return substr($content, 0, -1);
    }

    public function characet($data, $targetCharset) {
        return mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, 'UTF-8');
    }

    public function curlPost($url = '', $postData = '', $options = array()) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, 0);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }
}
?>

<?php
function download_image($url, $filepath) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    if (!$ch) {
        echo "cURL initialization failed.";
        return;
    }

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false); // For testing purposes, disable SSL verification

    $image_data = curl_exec($ch);
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        echo "cURL error: " . curl_error($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return;
    }

    curl_close($ch);

    if (file_put_contents($filepath, $image_data) === false) {
        echo "Failed to save the image to the specified file path.";
        return;
    }

    echo "Image downloaded and saved successfully.";
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a fluent interface for making HTTP requests using cURL, supporting various HTTP methods, request configurations, and response handling.

Class Description: The Httpie class is a fluent HTTP client wrapper for cURL in PHP that simplifies making HTTP requests with method chaining. It supports GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE methods, allows setting headers, query parameters, and different body types (raw, JSON, form), and provides options for error handling and response processing.

Attributes:
- method: string - The HTTP method to use for the request (GET, POST, etc.)
- url: string - The target URL for the request
- headers: array - Associative array of HTTP headers
- body: string - The request body content
- curlopts: array - Additional cURL options to set
- nothrow: bool - Whether to suppress exceptions on errors

Methods:
- __construct() -> void - Constructor that checks for cURL extension availability
- get(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for GET requests
- post(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for POST requests
- patch(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for PATCH requests
- put(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for PUT requests
- delete(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for DELETE requests
- query(array $params) -> self - Adds query parameters to the URL
- header(string $header, string $value) -> self - Adds a single header
- body(string $body) -> self - Sets raw request body
- jsonBody(array $data) -> self - Sets JSON request body
- formBody(array $data) -> self - Sets form-urlencoded request body
- setopt(int $key, mixed $value) -> self - Sets custom cURL option
- nothrow(bool $on = true) -> self - Configures error throwing behavior
- send(?array &$info = null) -> string - Executes the request and returns response
- getJson() -> mixed - Executes request and returns parsed JSON response
right_result:
<?php
class Httpie {
    protected $method;
    protected $url;
    protected $headers = [];
    protected $body;
    protected $curlopts = [];
    protected $nothrow;

    public function __construct() {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new Exception('cURL extension is not available.');
        }
    }

    public static function get(string $url) {
        return (new Httpie())->method('GET')->url($url);
    }

    public static function post(string $url) {
        return (new Httpie())->method('POST')->url($url);
    }

    public static function patch(string $url) {
        return (new Httpie())->method('PATCH')->url($url);
    }

    public static function put(string $url) {
        return (new Httpie())->method('PUT')->url($url);
    }

    public static function delete(string $url) {
        return (new Httpie())->method('DELETE')->url($url);
    }

    public function method(string $method) {
        $this->method = $method;
        return $this;
    }

    public function url(string $url) {
        $this->url = $url;
        return $this;
    }

    public function query(array $params) {
        $this->url .= http_build_query($params, '', '&', PHP_QUERY_RFC3986);
        return $this;
    }

    public function header(string $header, string $value) {
        $this->headers[$header] = $value;
        return $this;
    }

    public function body(string $body) {
        $this->body = $body;
        return $this;
    }

    public function jsonBody(array $data) {
        $this->body = json_encode($data);
        $this->headers['Content-Type'] = 'application/json';
        return $this;
    }

    public function formBody(array $data) {
        $this->body = http_build_query($data, '', '&', PHP_QUERY_RFC3986);
        $this->headers['Content-Type'] = 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded';
        return $this;
    }

    public function setopt(int $key, mixed $value) {
        $this->curlopts[$key] = $value;
        return $this;
    }

    public function nothrow(bool $on = true) {
        $this->nothrow = $on;
        return $this;
    }

    public function send(?array &$info = null) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($ch, $this->curlopts);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $this->url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, array_values($this->headers));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $this->method);

        if ($this->body) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $this->body);
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if ($info) {
            $info['http_code'] = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
            $info['size_download'] = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_SIZE_DOWNLOAD);
            $info['total_time'] = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_TOTAL_TIME);
        }

        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $error = curl_error($ch);

        if ($error && !$this->nothrow) {
            throw new Exception("cURL error: $error");
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    public function getJson() {
        $response = $this->send();
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes HTTP requests using cURL with support for various configurations including authentication, custom requests, and proxy settings.

Function Description: The function performs HTTP requests to a specified URL with configurable options. It supports basic authentication, Bearer token authentication, custom HTTP methods, POST requests with JSON payloads, and proxy configuration. The function handles response retrieval and error checking, returning the decoded JSON response.

Input:
- $url (string): The target URL for the HTTP request
- $auth (bool, optional): Whether to use authentication (default: true)
- $customRequest (string, optional): Custom HTTP method (e.g., 'PUT', 'DELETE')
- $postFields (array, optional): Data to send in the request body (will be JSON encoded)

Output:
- Returns the decoded JSON response from the server as a PHP object/array
- Returns null if the response cannot be decoded as JSON
right_result:
<?php
function makeHttpRequest($url, $auth = true, $customRequest = null, $postFields = []) {
    $ch = curl_init();

    // Set the URL
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);

    // Set the custom request method if provided
    if ($customRequest) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $customRequest);
    }

    // Set POST fields if provided
    if (!empty($postFields)) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($postFields));
    }

    // Set headers for JSON content type
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, ['Content-Type: application/json']);

    // Enable follow location
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);

    // Return the response as a string instead of outputting it
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);

    // Set proxy if needed (example: http://proxy.example.com:8080)
    // Uncomment and modify as needed
    // curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, 'http://proxy.example.com:8080');

    // Set authentication if required
    if ($auth) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPAUTH, CURLAUTH_BASIC);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERPWD, 'username:password'); // Replace with actual credentials
    }

    // Execute the request
    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    // Check for errors
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        return null;
    }

    // Close the cURL session
    curl_close($ch);

    // Decode the JSON response
    $jsonResponse = json_decode($response);

    // Check if JSON decoding was successful
    if (json_last_error() === JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
        return $jsonResponse;
    } else {
        return null;
    }
}
?>

<?php
function get($url, $header) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $header);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 5);
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}

function post($url, $data, $header) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $header);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 5);
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;

function gethead($url, $header) {

Task Description: Create a PHP function that extracts article information (title and cover image URL) from a WeChat public article URL using cURL and regular expressions.

Function Description: The function takes a WeChat article URL as input, fetches the HTML content using cURL, then extracts the article title and cover image URL using regular expressions. The cover image URL is processed through a third-party image service (weserv.nl) to get a standardized version. The function returns an associative array containing the extracted information and a success flag.

Input: 
- $url (string): The URL of a WeChat public article (must contain 'mp.weixin.qq.com')

Output: 
- Returns an associative array with these keys:
  - 'title' (string): Extracted article title (empty string if not found)
  - 'cover' (string): Processed cover image URL (empty string if not found)
  - 'success' (bool): True if both title and cover were successfully extracted
right_result:
<?php
function extractWeChatArticleInfo($url) {
    if (strpos($url, 'mp.weixin.qq.com') !== false) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        $html = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        // Extract title using regex
        preg_match('/<title>(.*?)<\/title>/i', $html, $matches);
        $title = isset($matches[1]) ? trim($matches[1]) : '';

        // Extract cover image URL using regex
        preg_match('/"cover_url":\s*["\']([^"\']+)["\']/i', $html, $matches);
        $coverUrl = isset($matches[1]) ? trim($matches[1]) : '';

        // Process cover URL through weserv.nl
        if (!empty($coverUrl)) {
            $coverUrl = str_replace('https://mmbiz.qpic.cn', 'https://cdn.weserv.nl', $coverUrl);
        }

        return [
            'title' => $title,
            'cover' => $coverUrl,
            'success' => !empty($title) && !empty($coverUrl)
        ];
    } else {
        return [
            'title' => '',
            'cover' => '',
            'success' => false
        ];
    }
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles webhook triggering using Guzzle HTTP client, including formatting headers and payload data, and processing responses or errors.

Class Description: The WebhookService class provides functionality to trigger webhooks by sending HTTP requests to specified endpoints. It handles request configuration, response processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- client: [Client] - Guzzle HTTP client instance used for making requests

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the Guzzle HTTP client instance
- triggerWebhook(mixed $data) -> [array] - Sends an HTTP request to the specified endpoint with formatted headers and payload
  Parameters:
    - $data: [mixed] - Contains request details including method, endpoint, headers, and payload
  Returns:
    - [array] - Response status ('success' or 'error') and content or error message
- formatHeaders(array $headers) -> [array] - Formats headers array into key-value pairs
  Parameters:
    - $headers: [array] - Raw headers array to be formatted
  Returns:
    - [array] - Formatted headers as key-value pairs
- formatPayload($payload) -> [array|string] - Formats payload data into key-value pairs
  Parameters:
    - $payload: [mixed] - Raw payload data to be formatted
  Returns:
    - [array|string] - Formatted payload as key-value pairs or original string if not array
right_result:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class WebhookService
{
    protected $client;

    public function __construct()
    {
        $this->client = new Client();
    }

    public function triggerWebhook($data)
    {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->request(
                $data['method'],
                $data['endpoint'],
                [
                    'headers' => $this->formatHeaders($data['headers']),
                    'json' => $this->formatPayload($data['payload'])
                ]
            );

            return [
                'status' => 'success',
                'content' => (string) $response->getBody()
            ];
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return [
                'status' => 'error',
                'content' => $e->getMessage()
            ];
        }
    }

    private function formatHeaders(array $headers)
    {
        return array_map(function ($value, $key) {
            return "$key: $value";
        }, $headers, array_keys($headers));
    }

    private function formatPayload($payload)
    {
        if (is_array($payload)) {
            return array_map(function ($value, $key) {
                return "$key: $value";
            }, $payload, array_keys($payload));
        }

        return (string) $payload;
    }
}

function serve_favicon($url, $cache_time, $default_ico, $basename = "favicon.ico") {
    // Extract domain from URL
    $domain = parse_url($url, PHP_URL_HOST);
    $cache_dir = __DIR__ . "/cache/";
    $cache_file = $cache_dir . md5($domain . $basename) . ".ico";
    $cache_age = time() + $cache_time;

    // Check if cache exists and is valid
    if (file_exists($cache_file) && filemtime($cache_file) > ($cache_age - $cache_time)) {
        header("Content-Type: image/x-icon");
        readfile($cache_file);
        return;
    }

    // Fetch favicon from remote server
    $ch = curl_init();
    $favicon_url = "https://" . $domain . "/" . $basename;
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $favicon_url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 5);

    $favicon_data = curl_exec($ch);
    $http_code = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    curl_close($ch);

    // Check if response is valid and is an image
    if ($http_code >= 200 && $http_code < 300) {
        $image_info = getimagesizefromstring($favicon_data);
        if ($image_info && $image_info['mime'] === 'image/x-icon') {
            // Save to cache
            file_put_contents($cache_file, $favicon_data);
            header("Content-Type: image/x-icon");
            echo $favicon_data;
            return;
        }
    }

    // Fallback to default icon
    if (file_exists($default_ico)) {
        header("Content-Type: image/x-icon");
        readfile($default_ico);
    } else {
        header("HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found");
        echo "Default favicon not found.";
    }
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using cURL for making GET requests and downloading files from URLs.

Class Description: The HttpClient class encapsulates cURL functionality to perform HTTP GET requests and file downloads. It provides static methods for simple URL fetching and file downloading with proper error handling and resource management.

Attributes: (This class doesn't have any attributes as it only contains static methods)

Methods:

Method1: urlGet(string $url, bool $follow_location = true, int $timeout = 10) -> string|bool - Performs a GET request to the specified URL. Follows redirects by default and allows setting a timeout. Returns the response content or throws an exception on error.

Method2: fileGet(string $url, string $target) -> string|bool - Downloads a file from the specified URL and saves it to the target location. Returns the output or throws an exception on error. Uses a longer default timeout for file downloads.
right_result:
<?php
class HttpClient {
    public static function urlGet(string $url, bool $follow_location = true, int $timeout = 10): string|bool {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, $follow_location);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $timeout);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            throw new Exception("cURL error: " . curl_error($ch));
        }
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    public static function fileGet(string $url, string $target): string|bool {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, fopen($target, 'wb'));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30); // Longer timeout for file downloads
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            throw new Exception("cURL error: " . curl_error($ch));
        }
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that interacts with Google Translate's unofficial API to translate text between languages.

Class Description: The GoogleTranslate class provides functionality to translate text from a source language to a target language using Google's translation service. It handles the HTTP request/response cycle and processes the JSON response to extract the translated text.

Attributes: None (This is a static utility class with no instance attributes)

Methods:

Method1: translate(string $source, string $target, string $text) -> string - Translates the given text from the source language to the target language. Throws an exception if the input text exceeds 9000 characters.

Method2: requestTranslation(string $source, string $target, string $text) -> string - Makes an HTTP POST request to Google Translate's API with the specified parameters and returns the raw JSON response. Handles cURL initialization, option setting, execution, and cleanup.

Method3: getSentencesFromJSON(string $json) -> string - Parses the JSON response from Google Translate and extracts the translated sentences, concatenating them into a single string.
right_result:
<?php
class GoogleTranslate {
    public function translate(string $source, string $target, string $text): string {
        if (strlen($text) > 9000) {
            throw new Exception("Input text exceeds maximum allowed length of 9000 characters.");
        }
        return $this->getSentencesFromJSON($this->requestTranslation($source, $target, $text));
    }

    public function requestTranslation(string $source, string $target, string $text): string {
        $url = "https://translate.googleapis.com/translate_a/single?client=gtx&sl=$source&tl=$target&dt=t&q=" . urlencode($text);
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    public function getSentencesFromJSON(string $json): string {
        $data = json_decode($json, true);
        if (isset($data[0]) && is_array($data[0])) {
            $translatedText = '';
            foreach ($data[0] as $sentence) {
                $translatedText .= $sentence[0];
            }
            return $translatedText;
        }
        return '';
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a PHP class for interacting with Alipay's API to process refund requests, including request signing and HTTP communication using cURL.

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides functionality to prepare and send refund requests to Alipay's payment gateway. It handles request signing, parameter encoding, and HTTP communication while maintaining necessary configuration parameters.

Attributes:
- appId: string - Alipay application ID
- returnUrl: string - URL for returning after payment
- notifyUrl: string - URL for payment notifications
- charset: string - Character encoding (default: 'utf-8')
- rsaPrivateKey: string - RSA private key for request signing
- outTradeNo: string - Merchant's unique order number
- tradeNo: string - Alipay's transaction number
- refundAmount: string - Amount to be refunded

Methods:
- __construct() -> void - Initializes the class with default charset
- setAppid(string $appid) -> void - Sets the Alipay application ID
- setRsaPrivateKey(string $saPrivateKey) -> void - Sets the RSA private key
- setOutTradeNo(string $outTradeNo) -> void - Sets the merchant's order number
- settradeNo(string $tradeNo) -> void - Sets Alipay's transaction number
- setRefundAmount(string $refundAmount) -> void - Sets the refund amount
- doRefund() -> array - Processes refund request and returns response
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType = "RSA") -> string - Generates request signature
- sign(string $data, string $signType = "RSA") -> string - Signs the request data
- checkEmpty(mixed $value) -> bool - Checks if value is empty
- getSignContent(array $params) -> string - Prepares string for signing
- characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) -> string - Handles character encoding conversion
- curlPost(string $url = '', mixed $postData = '', array $options = array()) -> string - Executes cURL POST request
right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    public $appId;
    public $returnUrl;
    public $notifyUrl;
    public $charset = 'utf-8';
    public $rsaPrivateKey;
    public $outTradeNo;
    public $tradeNo;
    public $refundAmount;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->appId = '';
        $this->returnUrl = '';
        $this->notifyUrl = '';
        $this->charset = 'utf-8';
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = '';
        $this->outTradeNo = '';
        $this->tradeNo = '';
        $this->refundAmount = '';
    }

    public function setAppid(string $appid) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
    }

    public function setRsaPrivateKey(string $rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setOutTradeNo(string $outTradeNo) {
        $this->outTradeNo = $outTradeNo;
    }

    public function setTradeNo(string $tradeNo) {
        $this->tradeNo = $tradeNo;
    }

    public function setRefundAmount(string $refundAmount) {
        $this->refundAmount = $refundAmount;
    }

    public function doRefund(): array {
        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'out_trade_no' => $this->outTradeNo,
            'trade_no' => $this->tradeNo,
            'refund_amount' => $this->refundAmount,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA',
            'charset' => $this->charset
        ];

        $sign = $this->generateSign($params);
        $params['sign'] = $sign;

        $response = $this->curlPost('https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do', $params);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    public function generateSign(array $params, string $signType = "RSA"): string {
        $content = $this->getSignContent($params);
        return $this->sign($content, $signType);
    }

    public function sign(string $data, string $signType = "RSA"): string {
        if ($signType === "RSA") {
            $privateKey = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
            openssl_sign($data, $signature, $privateKey, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
            openssl_free_key($privateKey);
            return base64_encode($signature);
        }
        return '';
    }

    public function checkEmpty(mixed $value): bool {
        return is_null($value) || empty($value);
    }

    public function getSignContent(array $params): string {
        $params = $this->arrayToXml($params);
        return $params;
    }

    public function characet(string $data, string $targetCharset): string {
        return mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, 'UTF-8');
    }

    public function curlPost(string $url = '', mixed $postData = '', array $options = array()): string {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, 0);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    private function arrayToXml($arr): string {
        if (!is_array($arr)) {
            return htmlspecialchars($arr);
        }

        $xml = '<xml>';
        foreach ($arr as $key => $val) {
            if (is_numeric($val)) {
                $xml .= "<$key>$val</$key>";
            } else {
                $xml .= "<$key>" . $this->characet($val, 'GBK') . "</$key>";
            }
        }
        $xml .= '</xml>';
        return $xml;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using cURL, supporting both GET and POST methods, with optional SSL verification and file upload safety checks.

Function Description: The function makes HTTP requests to a specified URL, with optional POST data. It handles SSL verification automatically based on the URL scheme (https/http) and includes safety checks for file uploads. The function returns the raw response from the server.

Input:
- $url: string - The target URL for the HTTP request
- $data: mixed (optional) - Data to be sent with POST request (default: empty string)

Output:
- string - The raw response data from the server
- false - If the cURL request fails (though error handling is minimal in this implementation)
right_result:
<?php
function http_request($url, $data = '') {
    $ch = curl_init();

    // Determine SSL verification based on URL scheme
    $verify_ssl = (strpos($url, 'https') === 0);

    // Set cURL options
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, $verify_ssl);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, $verify_ssl);

    // Check if POST method is needed
    if ($data !== '') {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
    }

    // Execute the request
    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    // Check for errors
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        return false;
    }

    // Close the cURL session
    curl_close($ch);

    return $response;
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes an HTTP POST request to the OpenAI API's image generation endpoint using cURL, with proper headers, timeout settings, and error handling.

Function Description: The function sends a POST request to the OpenAI API to generate images based on the provided input data. It sets up necessary headers including authentication, configures cURL options for secure communication (with SSL verification disabled for testing purposes), handles redirects, and manages timeout settings. The function returns the raw API response.

Input:
- $postData: [string] - JSON-encoded string containing the image generation parameters
- $OPENAI_API_KEY: [string] - The API key for authenticating with OpenAI's service

Output:
- [string] - The raw response data from the API call, which should be a JSON string containing either the generated image information or an error message
right_result:
<?php
function openai_image_generation($postData, $OPENAI_API_KEY) {
    $url = 'https://api.openai.com/v1/images/generations';
    $headers = [
        'Content-Type: application/json',
        'Authorization: Bearer ' . $OPENAI_API_KEY
    ];

    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        return 'cURL error: ' . curl_error($ch);
    }

    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}
